Btc-zDKFOwwmewsJQLcapg.review_text: A cool place for beers once you get pass the neighborhood. Charcuterie platter was good because it comes with pork belly. Young, good looking crowd. Kudos to the bouncer at the door. He was pretty attentive and nice. He got rid of the guy that followed our friend in. People pee everywhere around here. Mistakenly parked around the corner and walked passed a lady that squatted right on the sidewalk in front of a crowd of people. Shocking and traumatized. It's tenderloin. Cheers!

buhUgeRm7OpQtVE68Q2qZQ.review_text: Love this place. If there is such a thing as a beer geek, this is where you will find him. Will eventually need to get past burger and try the sausages.

HCmzfEC_w0wVZYunPOMHFA.review_text: I love trying new mikkeller's beers so it's so fun to have this place here and try them all! Their fries were delicious, the beer selection extensive and the decor was really fun.

DdsU7PkQqovVXoFnbHiG2g.review_text: Great selection of beers, and they give you a tasting if you ask about a beer. The fries - OMG - so crunchy! And slightly vinegary, delicious. The atmosphere is cool, and the staff are great. So many taps

m8nQ9i-Peo5zfZqfnc7LuA.review_text: My husband and I went here during our California honeymoon beer trip and loved it. The beer menu was insane. The staff were super nice and  knowledgeable. We ordered a 1999 Drie Fonteinen Geuze. It was delicious. Couldn't believe they had that on the menu. I highly recommend this place.

n2-zPkdWd7Y_zwOjwkCtnQ.review_text: It can get pretty crowded here on weekends, but with reservations, this is a great place for groups. Also a good casual date place. The downstairs bar area has a more chill atmosphere whereas the main floor is always bustling with people. Delicious german beers and sausages!

65uUyG9yuF0rdMh0z7ajaA.review_text: You want an insane beer selection? Mikkeller has got you covered. It rotates all the time, so don't expect those 42 taps to be the same the next time you're there. They also have a sour-only room downstairs which is pretty cool.  The biggest problem with Mikkeller is that it's WAY TOO GODDAMN LOUD. Holy shit. They really couldn't put any sound baffling in their entire brick and wood and concrete box? I realize it's all industrial-chic, but if the place is packed, you'll be hoarse after about 30 minutes of trying to talk to the person next to you.  On an off-night, on the other hand, when you're not squished between 6 other people (guessing they've been ignoring the fire code for capacity...) it's actually a nice place to relax and have some interesting beers. They're all served in small snifter-y glasses, in relatively small pours, making it easy to have a bunch of different things.

ph-TxEGbtgPWFz6FvDcJEg.review_text: Waste of time. Don't bother bringing anything business related here. You'll spend all your time complaining about lack of service and trying to figure out who is a bartender from who is your bartender..  Yes, knew 4 people with tabs - on the same day, all couldn't get new orders in for over 35 mins because their bartender was busy and no one else would bother.

HwxKs9Cu-y87kCIbfFedSA.review_text: Great drink selection - but the food was just okay.  Mussels were tiny, smokies were alright - fries were standard.  The place was packed when we went - so we sat up front, which was a bit odd as you really felt removed from the restaurant.  Though on the plus side, it meant we were a bit farther away from the noise.    I'd come back for drinks but probably not for food.

JibN6XRd2LCQeTg-JgkjGw.review_text: The sour tasting room downstairs is molded after their european partners (goofy colored paint and all) and WOW, the sours here are really really good.

NfU0zDaTMEQ4-X9dbQWd9A.review_text: I'm the tourist idiot who had never heard of Mikkeller beers before, but even without being a big beer drinker--I loved Mikkeller Bar!  My story starts with a vacation to the Bay Area and a special date night in San Francisco with my man. We checked into our hotel around 3PM and we were so hungry--too hungry to wait for dinner. My guy wanted something gastro-pub-ish so I busted out my trusty Yelp app and searched for one around us. Well, as always, Yelp knows what's up, especially in SF. Don't question. It pointed us to Mikkeller Bar, which is very unassuming from the outside--so much so that we almost missed it.   Anyways, it wasn't busy since it was a weird time of day and week to be there. I liked it! No TVs to be seen, just a peaceful vibe. We ordered a ton of food, including the cheese and meat board, the fries, olives and the bacon-wrapped mini hot dogs. We also ordered one of their two red wine selections, which was delicious, but way overpriced--almost like you're being punished for not drinking the beer. Anyways, the FOOD! I have zero complaints. The fries were all kinds of perfect. And you can't go wrong with bacon wrapped mini hot dogs. The cheese and meat board was great because we got to select what we wanted, that way we knew we'd love everything. But I loved their little mini-pickles! And the warm olives were great, although I think the ones I make at home are better.   Overall I really enjoyed the food. Mikkeller Bar reminded me of a few gastropubs out in Cleveland, but way, way more expensive. Hence the lack of the 5th star. The wine was way too overpriced, even for SF. The rest of the selections were good and the price hike made sense... I mean, you are in San Francisco. But it was a delicious experience overall and Yelp pulled through for us in a big way with Mikkeller!

nYXgSTJbcBl30yL8IF9FDQ.review_text: Went here on a Monday night and it was packed. Our party of three wandered around, finally finding spaces crammed against the back wall. It wasn't the most comfortable of seating but we were happy to take anything. Their selection of beer on tap is quite large (nearly 50 kinds) and they have them all classified and serve them at their optimal drinking temperature. This is all part of their custom "on the fly" gas blending system that ensures that their beer is served at the correct temperatures for you to enjoy all the flavors you would normally miss from a standard tapped pour. Honestly, I couldn't discern the difference. In addition they also have a wide and eclectic menu with options like spicy giardiniera, muffuletta sausage sandwich, and sour cherries and sweet chocolate bread pudding. I personally loved the soundtrack: 1990's hip-hop. Between the food, the drinks, and the atmosphere, it's easy to see why Mikkeller Bar is a popular place.

sXKmP90GCdF0oM0AzYRhaQ.review_text: If you're like a beer geek or just a hipster making your way around town, Mikkeller is the place to go. It's a gastropub with awesome french fries on their menu and crazy sausage platter that's worth dying for.   They have quite an impressive selection of draught beers that won't leave you disappointed. Whatever you need--house wheat, IPA, ales, espresso stout--they'll have it. Their seating arrangement is quite unique, so if you're planning to come with a bigger party, be sure to make a reservation to get seated in a table. Otherwise, the bar is a first-come-first serve-good-ol'-time. Also check out the massive Danish illustration on their ceiling.

E5Fbnoe5f5a74A5auXjiBg.review_text: Nom-nom-nom...  I wish their food menu was a little more pub grub and a little less head cheese.  That being said, the beers are excellent.  The ambiance is perfect for meeting the crew and havin' a brew. (see what I did there? poetry).  This gastropub actually mad me a fan of Mikkeller beers.  I'd tried some previously, but I left here a supporter.

cqf8dqO5_QUxjfo6WiM7yg.review_text: This place was open on New Year's Day, which alone deserves three stars to start. (I cannot tell you how many doors were shut in the area.)  It was pretty empty, too, which is always a plus for me. (Who wants to wait in line at 6pm on New Year's Day? I'd done plenty of that the night before, stupid W Hotel! *grumble grumble*)  We wanted some beer (ahem, hair of the dog) and a bite to eat. I opted for the red ale with the eggplant parmesan sandwich and a side of fries. He went for the brown ale, the beef dip sandwich, and a side of salad. The winner? My eggplant parm with his salad. Both beers were delicious. Service was incredibly friendly, and prices were about on par with typical gastropubs.  I can see myself revisiting this place for a solid pint (or three), a handful of marcona almonds, and good conversation with the servers.

i6nzTfZ8TRckJOGgZIpr5Q.review_text: I came here without even realizing what we were doing. In my defense, I was a little delirious and full of pizza. But, really, there's no excuse. Especially with a beer crazy husband who saves all of his unique bottles and boxes (and I just packed all of those up in a move. I. SHOULD. HAVE. KNOWN.).  Regardless, I enjoyed this place enough, but I'm not positive my visit could really warrant more than three stars. To begin, we were a little exhausted to say the least, coming to the end of our trip and wanting to squeeze in some time with friends that had moved to San Fran. We were a little confused when, on the way here, we went through the most unsavory area that we saw during the entire trip. But, that trip was worth it when we were met with the cavernous interior decorated with the signature Mikkeller artwork that I immediately warmed up to. Having only one beer here, though, doesn't really give me a good idea of the place. It was a good beer, but that's all I can really say. Our server was also pretty "meh" and didn't seem to REALLY enjoy our banter. The rest of the patrons here didn't seem to be having the most fun either.   Maybe it was just an off day, but I wasn't thrilled. I'm sure we'll keep Mikkeller in mind when we're in town again, but I can't guarantee I'll jump at the opportunity to come back.

QrR7HmI39mkGBxy7Y0g2CA.review_text: As a bay area beer nerd, this place is pretty amazing. There are may more beers than a single person could ever try and thats saying a lot coming from me. There is also a "sour" room downstairs that has tons of sour beers. It sounds silly but the best way I can describe the selection is "Infinity times two".   I've been here twice and both times the service was perfect. First we had a skinny bald gentleman who was somehow amazingly attentive despite the fact that it was a packed house. The second time, we had a waitress who looked like Sasha Grey and never let us have a glass that was 1/3'rd empty.   I didn't try the food but I'd like to. If its anything like the craftsmanship the put into their beer, it'll be a complete home-run

0C4ccDiZlnW68ULoDKE3NA.review_text: I was eagerly watching and waiting for this place to open. I was sure that it would get 5 stars just because of getting fresh Mikkeller and To Øl beers. I was right. I had the opportunity to travel to SF in August and stopped at Mikkeller as often as I could and even got to know some local beer geeks.  The place is sleek and modern and packed every night. I was travelling alone, so I was happy to squeeze into a space at the bar. The selection (Mikkeller and To Øl heavy) was great and after trying a whole bunch of the draft brews, I split some intriguing bottles with the aforementioned beer geeks that I met.  Sadly, due to arriving late each day, I never got a chance to try any of the food menu, but it looked quite good and others let me know it was so. I can't wait to come back.

zsixS8VmcoHayLVwJ6Tcvw.review_text: Great beer selection, lousy for wine. The NOISE level is unbelievable. This allows you to hold private conversations with your friend sitting across from you by shouting at the top of your lungs, without worrying that anyone else within 5 feet could overhear you. The biggest disappointment was the food. The selections are excellent but someone in the kitchen forgot to add taste. Mac 'n Cheese was boring. Brat was even more bland. The french fries, however, were excellent. Meh, I've had better.

dRFjr-O0rCMM16f8j5LBsg.review_text: A fantastic bar with a stellar selection of beer. The place was very clean and had a fun atmosphere. They had a really nice selection of their own beers plus a great mix of other craft beers. The service was excellent I didn't eat anything but the food looked excellent.

6apA5rajkHBdEnukxHrELA.review_text: I hate it here so much. I love San Francisco. I love how it is a dynamic city that is changing. But this bar is trying so hard to confirm that this city has become a cesspool of douchebag assholes. Enough said.   Institutional design. Room downstairs is like a correctional facility for delinquent middle schoolers. The extra star is for the bartenders, waitstaff, and beer selection. They are superb.

bBatDAPQGkKDnidg616mig.review_text: Come for the beer, stay for the beer! The food looks great, but the beer kept my attention! There are too many choices!!

AefaF4-vF5l2EB_-9i4wow.review_text: Awesome beer selection. Didn't try the food, we were there for the taps... :)  Ambiance is nice, bustling without being too noisy. Crowd is mixed, all ages and styles get along in the trendy space.

pzwPuIDTpsd_ykGJ0CtuCg.review_text: Beers & appetizers only-  Awesome Gastro pub.  Very spacious w/ a clean/modern look.  42 beers on tap w/ lots of variety.    If you are beer lover you will dig this place.    We also shared a few appetizers.  The Garlic Fries & Korean wings.  Both were pretty good.  I'd get them again.  TIPS: -Prices aren't the cheapest at $8.50-$9 a glass. -Hipster joint. No ranch dressing :P -Area is kinda sketchy at night.  -Open till 2AM, kitchen closes at 11.

RTvAr6Sga-cQeEfxLcZ8ag.review_text: I was skeptical of the location when my fiance suggested it, but decided why not...  It turned out better than I expected.  We were seated right away in a booth  (this is on a Saturday around 2:00 pm) and served promptly.  The beers and food were very good.  The macaroni and cheese was delicious and cheesy.  Plenty to share as a side dish.  I had the salad and although tasty, a bit overdressed.  My fiance enjoyed his burger - very juicy and seasoned really well.  Definitely a good place for beers and a quick bite.

jBQGwEvLnIL8X0hCqa0jzQ.review_text: What a great place in the heart of downtown SF. You might just breeze past this place sandwiched near the corner of a busy intersection and a live music venue but you'd be missing a gem. Walk in and you're greeted with an industrial style, open space with its own heaping portion of red brick and steal I-beams. The focal point is the U shaped bar at the center and where your attention should be when you sit down. A craft brew specialist, Mikkeller Bar has a plethora of Californian micros on tap and they know their beer. All served at the proper temps and in the proper glassware, you know you're in for an experience as soon as you've ordered your first beer.   Also billed as a gastropub, Mikkeller Bar doesn't disappoint with food either. A small but tasty menu awaits you and your tastebuds. I had the roasted chicken breast and I can tell you that I've rarely had chicken this good and so well prepared. Both juicy, tender and delicious, the crisped skin is the perfect pair to the breast meat. Although a small portion by normal US standards, it's just right. Paired with a maque choux, mild red chile sauce and grits it really hit the spot.  If I had one critique it would be that the grits were slightly runny for my taste but for a restaurant so removed from the grit bastion of the south central United States, I was impressed.   I certainly see this place being a big hang out spot on Fridays after work and a great place to bring a group if people for good food and good beer. Definitely a MUST TRY the next time you're in the area.

f0ky_aw9bwdlcyFJLYJYBA.review_text: Great beer and great service.  Didn't try them but fries smell awesome. My waitress was sweet, her name was Natalia- very well versed, great knowledge,  communication and suggestions! !

Ox8NO6IwNej6ElAbn07oJg.review_text: Great Belgian beer bar. 40 taps, half of them I have never had. A little above average prices. Lots of Belgian beers and dishes.   20 bar stools. 18 sidewall ledge spots. Two 8-top social tables. 5 booths. Really good bar space for any sized group.   Aged-industrial, wood and brick decor. Fancy chill vibe. Nice spot in the Tenderloin. Can't believe I didn't know about this place.

lOA4PUwYQUkrGMV7CsW8Yg.review_text: Amazing beer selection and really good food. I love the fact that they have more then just mikkellar beers. I've only been once and it was such a great time. I cant wait to go back and try more beers and more food. The Ruben is amazing

hS2oYA9J0AKa4pE0lzE8gQ.review_text: Great selection of beers. Tried the tenderloin pale ale and was served at the optimum temperature. Prices are justified by the quality. Would drop by again if in the area to try the different ones available.

MKajNHeGqGgaD3genarNrA.review_text: I've eaten there three days in a Row.  It was open seating.   I crowded into a bar area and order was taken promptly.   My waitress took time to explain the taste of the beer that I had selected.   Had the lunch special.  A lager, bratwurst with grilled onions, and fries.  Day two, I had the burger well done with Fries.  I wolfed it down.  Day three I had the smokies wrapped in bacon with a ginger beer.  Wonderful, wonderful.

f1MFQxTZAWJnRQdrouLg_A.review_text: The quick and dirty: Great for high quality beers at, all things relative, a reasonable price. Bad for food.   In town for a conference, a group of guys all wanted to grab a bite and some drinks, and once we learned that Mikkeller Bar was close to our hotel, we were sold. I once managed a beer bar, and let me tell you, Mikkeller is something special, and I was salivating at the idea of going to a bar dedicated to their brews. I had high expectations, but even then was impressed with their beer list. It's not organized by style so much as it is by the temperature served. It might not be the easiest for a novice to navigate, but it's proof they know their shiz. I was very happy with my selections.  Food, however? Not so much. I think we might have had false expectations of this place being more of a restaurant than it actually is. I had a reuben with fries. The reuben was pretty burnt yet my fries were cold. I could have sent it back, but didn't. I can't knock them off a star when I was being a silent sufferer. But I will say that in our group of 8, who all got pretty different items, nobody was blown away by their food.  Moral of my story: I would go back for a beer (or three or four) but I'd eat before or after at one of the dozens of superior restaurants that are relatively nearby.

fSzJO3tSVQ6DNx6jNf_fzA.review_text: Borderline TL, but once you're inside and safe, you'll quickly forget your woes. This is mostly due to the fact that your first beer will be 9% abv. Your first brat will be delicious. The Reuben, equally tasty. The service, friendly and knowledgeable. After all, you'll need all the help you can get to pronounce the O with a line through it....

mROok9JZx19AwvOJlI8FHQ.review_text: Great beers but skip the food.  I got the slow roast pork sandwich ($16) and it seemed a bit tough and dry. I didn't even finish it and I generally finish any food I have at lunch. A bit disappointing for a $16 sandwich.  The beers were excellent with Firestone Walker Pivo Hoppy Pils being my favorite. The beers aren't pints which is kind of a bummer.

XiQCUmJux8gCzkX1YUq2EA.review_text: Fantastic beers. If you like craft beers this is the place to go. Very knowledgeable staff and good food too

WJfNVm4mXXDt1Vakg13CpA.review_text: I love beer.   Therefore, I love Mikkeler Bar and all that it represents. Excellent beer selection, served properly at the appropriate temperatures, and awesomely chill environment to just hang out and talk.   Beers range from $6-$10, for the most part. That's normally what you pay for a glass of Beer in SF, but hardly any places carry the wide selection that Mikkeler does. Not to mention that Mikkeler brews their own beer as well. So for the price, it's a great deal.   Mikkeler's Bar is, imo, a hidden gem in Union Square. Not toursity at all. I like that they also have an accompanying restaurant, which I would like to try at some point. My friend and I sat at the Bar which practically glistened with handles of beers on draft. Just take a seat and order! The staff is very knowledgable when I asked for a few suggestions to start off.   My beer was tasty and the cheese/charcuterie platter was pretty good. Our server tried to find a good cheese/meat pairing for the beer. Overall, very impressed!  I can't wait to come here for a beer tasting at some point!

S2QjG1I6yAGRwfEKv5wVeg.review_text: Hidden gem. Don't let the outside appearance fool you. Delicious food, excellent beer, cozy setting,somewhat melancholy waiter.   The Texas Ranger sausage is delicious as is the Tenderloin IPA.

H4Pv95ubIogcGqY8GgekbQ.review_text: Came here twice after work for happy hours. The bartenders here are very douchy. They all look miserable and act like its the worst job ever. They like to talk amongst themselves and act like the customers are bothering them when asked to order. The waitress made a mistake on my friends beer and instead apologizing she grabbed his beer and storm off to make him a new one while completely ignoring him even though he was willing to drink the beer she made wrong. This place is really a vibe killer. Beers were good though, great selection.

8V4y5czt5cn2ioVBjz78UQ.review_text: This place is a beer bar first and foremost.  If you've had a Mikkeller beer before, you should know what you're getting yourself into when you walk in the doors.  For those that have not had the pleasure ... you're in for a treat.  I was impressed with a few things right off the bat, the bottle and tap list are extensive.  If you like beer, you'll find many thing you like here.  The staff was uber knowledge and helpful as well.  A few friends and I talked beer with the staff as we went through drink after drink.  They also had spot on recommendations ... we wanted a good sour and they delivered.  Mikkeller should be a destination for anyone that likes beer.  This will become a regular spot to visit on my San Francisco trips.

_gcDdPUVA9wwSynicxcpzw.review_text: I'm a fan of their beer selection. The food selection is much smaller, though the mussels and chicken were done well. I kind of wish there was something more enticing on the menu to jump out with all the amazing beer choices they offer.   Since it's a Mikkeller Bar....go with a MIkkeller beer! I wouldn't mind grabbing a couple drinks here with some friends; they have a nice, open warehouse-urban feel.

SKQld0XdYNrGJU8DSlR3KQ.review_text: Bacon wrapped hot dogs is a MUST and they have an awesome selection of beers!

xmSfcGW8W4N-m3YvxinHag.review_text: It was raining, and we needed to kill an hour before.. happy hour (eek?).... so my husband and I stopped in for some drinks. I was a little put off by the bouncer out front, afraid it might be too loungey, but we decided to give Mikkeller Bar a try.  They have a huge beer list. I don't drink beer. However, they do have a few wines by the glass available for weirdos like myself. The service was nice and attentive despite the early Saturday night crowd. Definitely a buzzing urban beer hall type of feel.  Feeling slightly peckish, we grabbed a snack of salt cod fritters. Delicious, delicious, delicious. And the spicy remoulade was a nice complement.

V-LWmzJi3Y65tFRGb2Z_Tg.review_text: Love this place.  First visit today with wife and two adult daughters.  Beer is amazing...quite a diverse beer menu.  I like pilsners so had the Upright Engelberg; wife  likes a little more flavor...she had the Stillwater Stateside Saison, daughters love the sours so they had Iron Springs D'ete and other sour beers.  And loved the food.  Started with the Butchers Board meats and condiments; Lil smokies are very good; two cheeses (fiscalini and pt reyes toms) seemed like small portions...but were wonderfully rich and plenty for the 4 of us to taste; also has mixed green and wedgie salads...both fresh and good.  Ambiance was perfect.  Cool and modern, and a bit industrial while still friendly, without being over-the-top nor for this 58 year old beer and small plates food lover.    One of the best things about the place was Kerri, our server.  Very knowledgable about everything on the menu...she went to great lengths to make sure she brought us beers that matched our less-than-clear descriptions of what we liked.  Kerri is awesome.  Will definitely be back.  Also tried the Cantillon Class beer...I know these are a rare breed...but I probably won't be ordering that anytime again soon.  My Coors Lite taste buds just can't appreciate something so potent.

ccwfIO2i4nfMDiluVEN0eQ.review_text: A little trendy on the design and serveware, but so good so good so good. And ahead of the sour trend, which is a nice addition.

3UwKQ5gp-tVQCkQ-jewWtQ.review_text: Unique atmosphere, incredible selection. Of beer, amazingly unique food combinations, and a phenomenally knowledgable and caring set of bar tenders.  Go out of your way to experience this gastropub!

qqp3dB1GMk5iwM0_KvYrxg.review_text: Great selection of beer that is constantly being updated. The bartenders/servers are very friendly and are great at recommending beers. The bartender offered us a number of samples as we were contemplating the beers before deciding what we wanted.

-mTVPMopYEhcUuOL1fX2Fw.review_text: I'm not sure what to say about this one. Overpriced, terrible neighborhood, overstaffed, odd menu-why would you do this?

ET8n-r7glWYqZhuR6GcdNw.review_text: I'm not going to pull any punches here: I was super hungover at the time of my visit to Mikkeller Bar (for the record, it was a lunchtime visit, not a nighttime visit - just wanted that to be clear). But since it was technically the first day of my vacation, I knew my only option was to get back on that horse. Wanting something easy-drinking, I opted for a bottled blackberry cider, which was pretty fantastic. It was served a bit warmer than I would have preferred but I like to drink everything ice cold. I didn't get the impression from our stoic server that requesting a glass of ice would go over well.   The menu featured sausages pretty prominently so I ordered the half smoke, a beef and pork link topped with mustard, onion and chili. It was every bit as delightful as it sounds. The cup of fries that came with was a generous portion of perfectly fried and salted spuds.   Those on the prowl for a beer-loving gent will certainly find more than a few at Mikkeller. During a semi-busy Friday afternoon lunch, there were exactly two women in the whole place, myself included. Also, the tunes were on point. Definitely looking forward to a revisit on my next trip to San Francisco.

DuwyQpApHDgQjPXYveNN1w.review_text: Tried this out and I'm not a beer person, so my review might be biased.  They do have a decent wine list and drinks were fine for non-beer drinks.  The two star review is for the food, which was below average in my estimation.  I didn't try the sausage which may be better than the falafel that I had.  Service was efficient, but not particularly friendly.  Venue is quite loud, keep that in mind if you're looking to have a conversation.

C-oONZ8hbne8gEjvyTL6Sg.review_text: The place looked really cool and hip. The food however I guess was only ok. The peanuts were pretty bland. The croquettes didn't have enough substance and could use more salted cod or w/e fish they use. Also they were placed on wilted butter lettuce. The beers, however were pretty good and interesting. The beers they brewed are tasty. My only complaint was not enough hops in the ipa's. It needed more balance.

U4Mos3ZeuUkb9ekQO7fbnQ.review_text: Lots to like about this place. Good beer selection, knowledgeable waiters and good service, great house made sausage. Very loud, and a bit on the pricey side (like $10 for an 8 oz glass of some beers). Support businesses trying to spruce up the depths of the 'loin like this.

ws6VBKkh6RhZH1afgAtFqA.review_text: pretty good beer selection, we order a bunch of food to share, all pretty good, except the cheese plate was surprising small.

O8xSBRkVQHDqHhW425uY0g.review_text: Good service. Great beer and knowledge. Best mussels I've ever had. The only downfall is I couldn't take any beer with me. What a great surprise this place was!!

t3QO4s0pol6wCuafpxdHcQ.review_text: Awesome changing menu of draft beer. Helpful staff to help me find the beer i always wanted!

mDTrcaA-0SvxG4AYmgMCMA.review_text: I can't say much about the beer but Mikkeller has the best fries/frites is SF. They're twice fried in rice bran oil. Sounds like the kitchen tested a lot of ways to fry and were able to produce the crispiest, most delicious fries. Also had muffuletta sausage and lil smokies. Lots of good salty snacks.   When we left, the bouncer next door showed us video he took of a car that hit a MUNI bus and fled. The guy ended up hitting some pedestrians on Market St. The driver was caught the next day. Cray cray in the TL.

7tzl97ztm-bfrD-xHWu2Vg.review_text: Wow!  Found this place on Yelp before my trip, and yes! It's all true.  Amazing micro beer selection, great Gastropub menu.  Had the PEI mussels cooked with beer, chorizo and red onion--so, so good!  It's near a lot of the big hotels, but in an area that's a little dicey on the outside.  If you can get past that, it's a great experience.  And filled with young folk who seemed to be local, so something is bringing them here, and it's the beer, the food and the great room.  Staff was also great, dealt with three of them...all helpful, knowledgeable and friendly.

gvnSj0hS5VhJFD6THOKAuQ.review_text: Without question this is a bar that serves beer to those that have discerning tastes.  Even if you are not caught up in the whirlwind that has become the world of beer since the craft brewery movement began giving us offerings like this, you will be able to find something to quench your thirst and make your taste buds happy.  A warning about the hipsters.  Brace for it, but don't be afraid.  It really wasn't as bad as I thought it could have been (nothing even close to approaching Logan Square in Chicago levels of hipster).  Expect to find a bar staff that is exceedingly knowledgeable and quick to offer suggestions or just keep pouring what you like.  In terms of the food what we had was quite good. They also have an open kitchen, and as one that appreciates the efficiency of a kitchen being ran the right way, you can see that these guys mean business.     We came at two different times and at each time we were able to find seating, but this is a popular place so be prepared for things to get a little shoulder bumpy as the evening gets close to the rush.

7ON-pEbPXzZ7dpMebSRzrg.review_text: Has got to be one of the coolest bars in SF. Great selection on draft and the eats are pretty good.  Was 3 block walk from hotel and ended up there 3 times in 3 days.  Just a couple minute walk from China town.  Get in early,  they get packed.

8Tllfos1YxyhvoxiGR0CbA.review_text: Dropped in last night with a friend from Los Angeles for a good local brew.  Mikkeller is a great bar in the Union Square area that feels more local than a lot of other bars in the area.  It's proximity to the tenderloin may be preventing tourists from finding it.  Depending on your attitude, that can be good, bad or both.  The vibe is casual and lively, and it was not crowded at all yesterday afternoon, the 1st of January.  It was a good spot for catching up with my buddy.  I ordered my usual IPA.  Theirs was stong on the taste, which I like, and it went straight to my head, since my stomach was empty.  My friend, after tasting several beers, went with a wit beer.  Indeed, their selection can be daunting.  It is a specialty beer bar, that is clear, but the servers are very patient and understanding.  They make sage suggestions.    Bring plenty of money, because these beers are not PBR affordable.  My modus to get value for my $ is to look only at the 50ml offerings.  Mikkeller is also a good place for big groups.  There are plenty of large table for groups, as well as lots of bar acreage and bar stools for smaller parties.  Try Mikkeller, it's literally 2 short blocks from the Powell cable car turnaround.  Cheers!

vv8NRb04olNjcc5lSWLd1w.review_text: This place is a beer connoisseur paradise. Sitting on the bar stool, sipping on a wine glass shaped thing filled with beer and talking about the same to the friend next to you makes you feel like you are a "chopped" judge. The beer selection in that place is extra-ordinary. I had the "broken dream" and some ale beer. Interesting stuff! Keep in mind this is not what you would drink at a frat party to get hammered. These are more like the drinks you would have when your taste buds are still alive to taste how interesting beer can be. Also, get here super early or you ll feel bar-homeless with no drink and no place.

1dcVU7UwpzdMA-VHBLgofw.review_text: Beer here.. nice bar with plenty of space to sit, talk, and enjoy your beer..

3TXNWQ-x98YphuVy2HegJA.review_text: Dangerous! I now have yet another watering hole near work where I can go to enjoy beer!  A friend and I stumbled in here one rainy evening after reading the EaterSF article about the top new joints in the city. Even though we already ate at AQ beforehand, we thought we'd come and have some drinks.  When I go to places like this, I always try and make sure I drink the beer made by that establishment. The first drink I ordered was a Mikkeller Double Eye PA... 14% ABV! That was a lot stronger than I anticipated, but definitely loved the flavoring of it. I'm also a sucker for IPAs.  Next drink I got when I came here with a coworker was their Beer Geek Brunch Weasel stout. Something I would definitely order again.  Next, our bartender said that if we liked stout-y drinks, he had a recommendation for us... The Gudeløs, which he said the literal translation meant "without God" (and $1 from every bottle sold of this beer goes to the Athiest society of Denmark or so... I can't remember specifically!). I wanted to try the beer but did not support where the $1 was going... :P This stout beer definitely went down very smoothly! I wouldn't order it regularly (one bottle cost maybe $20ish?), but it's worth trying.  Also, if you're into very hipster San Francisco locales, you'll love this place. Everyone was pretty friendly though, and they all looked like start-up workers.  I definitely want to come by sometime to try the sausages!

1ljC2JgUafYC9wtEUXJ3bQ.review_text: Fantastic, trendy bar near Union Square with 42 beers on tap that changes with the season.  It was a bit intimidating going up to order a beer because I didn't want to look like an idiot / order something awful.  But luckily, they don't serve shitty beer, so any choice you make will work!  Not sure the name of it, but I highly recommend getting some beer with limoncello.  I asked for the first thing on the menu, and the bartender could tell I had no idea what I was doing.  He let me try two different samples of beers that tasted light, and I settled for the limoncello one.  It was $10, so kind of pricey, but hey - it's good beer!  I think the last time I had shmancy imported beer was at Press Club.  Beer aside, the food was bomb.  Say yes to the fries, and say yes to the wings.  You won't regret it!  ... In other news, there's also an outlet in the women's bathroom next to the full length mirror that I used to charge my phone.  Really helpful information, I know.

uyBVGIz6KI04cyCyd2Edog.review_text: Yelp keeps asking me to write a review.  While I don't remember specifics, I will say this:  1) Excellent beer list.  I loved the beer compilaitons between Mikkeller and other regional brewers.  Certainly an eclectic menu and not something a craft beer newbie would appreciate. 2) Solid menu, my pulled pork with cheese and rapini (Broccoli rabe) was tasty and the truffle fries good.  3) What I liked the best was the location.  When I lived in SF I would have never been caught in the dark in this part of town--Tenderloin/Civic Center/ Lower Union Sq.  It felt odd walking into this place and not passing any prostitutes and homeless people.  Maybe the location gives it a cool vibe.  I will definitely go back!

JkrCREb08OwUrc5b2dGRfw.review_text: My husband is obsessed with sour beer at the moment so we came here for their extensive beer list.  We had a large group of people, and they were able to accommodate us pretty quickly. The menu was rather limited and the food was just ok although reasonable priced.  Definitely come here if you want specialty beers but be prepared to spend some bucks on those beers!

5BC31_MojYpWZCfcHfXZmw.review_text: Be sure to go here if you like weird and super interesting beers. They have them all.   Massive selection and super stoked staff. Shame I didn't have a chance to try the food but I would guess it is on the same level as their insane beer selection.   Also this is one of the nicest bars I have been to. Very Danish (of course) and welcoming.

PwBriZjb_u69RTujuaZPPA.review_text: I was visiting San Francisco and looking to try some good, local beers. Mikkeller was just the spot for me. They have a beer for everyone -- many I had not heard of before -- and serve them at their "proper" temperature. I even got to try Alpine's "Hoppy Birthday"...a beer that's been on my list for a while now.   It was dinnertime so I ordered the beef sausage with jalapeno, fried onions and chipotle ranch. It was delicious and paired well with the beers I was drinking.  Service was okay -- I wish the server had been more open to discussing the different beer options with me but he didn't seem to want to chat.  The bar itself was cozy and had a "hipster" vibe (95% of the men were wearing plaid), however the area outside was a little sketchy. Still worth a trip over for the beer though!

Qv84DxksfsNxZID5G08q9Q.review_text: Was lucky enough to score a private tour yesterday with our beer group.  It was absolutely awesome!  Amazing Mikkeller beers, three of which are made just for the San Francisco location.  (The Tenderloin beers named appropriately for the neighborhood.)    They have an extensive list of hard to find craft beer, Mikkeller and other fantastic beers.  The staff was really friendly and were extremely knowledgeable.  They are still in soft open right now, but once they officially open their doors this bar is going to be jammed packed!  What a great addition to San Francisco!!!

3bEyiBGXoodFnvMuTHNbfA.review_text: The beer was fine, but the food was a disappointment.    I ordered the pork shoulder sandwich with broccoli rabe.  It was rather plain and one note, and desperately in need of an aioli sauce or something.  I definitely wouldn't come again for the food.

3CHphjJcE6MSs9aLW-X8AQ.review_text: For a beer lover, this place must be paradise!  I'm

QzkZXHY3ol_mOI1Tr69XlQ.review_text: Wow. The beer selection here is amazing.  And it changes daily so you get a huge variety.  Limited food but better than just regular bar food. Highly recommend stopping in and checking it out.

20K4NaWmoWH_squ2GWu98Q.review_text: Trevor hooked us up! Everyone was very knowledgeable when it came to the beers they serve. Chill vibe. Highly recommend.

NQWEL3b_VwHNCfu4OB6nqQ.review_text: FYI ... the Mikkeller shirt designs rotate every three months. So if you wait to get a shirt, they might not have a particular design the next time around.

NP-675YVy9URhNmdQdnWsQ.review_text: We really enjoyed the soft opening on Friday. The line was long (and it probably will be for a while), but I appreciated that it was not TOO crowded or crazy inside. The layout seems pretty nice, with a fair number of separate as well as communal tables, and some space up front (where you can't get food food but can get almonds, pickled vegetables, and of course beer).   The beer was fantastic, it almost goes without saying. I was really impressed with how organized they were right from the get-go, with plenty of very friendly servers everywhere. The only opening-day kink that we experienced was that one person's bratwurst got lost in the shuffle - which was more than compensated for by a plate of pickled vegetables (I especially liked the tomatoes and cauliflower - the mushrooms were not as much of a hit to me, but still interesting) and smoked marcona almonds (these were pretty divisive - I found them too salty and almost bacon-y for my taste). I liked all the sausages - we also tried a roast pork sandwich with cheese on it. Both were very tasty, but a little greasy - as my companion remarked, there's a reason pork sandwiches don't normally have cheese. I would have liked the fish/potato cakes to be more potato, less fish, but the sauce that came with them was good.  All in all, I look forward to going back to this very-conveniently located bar!

YQoY_ygdtOaYgmdj3cNi1Q.review_text: It's a really central good place to get specialty beers.  They have tables for food up front, a large circular bar in the middle, and community tables in the back.  Service is exceptional.  I especially like that if you open a tab, they swipe your card once and give it back, instead of the usual let me find your card routine at bars that makes you wonder what you were thinking when you said yes to opening a tab.  Four stars only because Toronado and Pi have just as good beers at slightly better prices and are open later.  But on Market Street, can't really beat the spot.

XfDTYh58OyUtq6lAPdIf_Q.review_text: Welcome to one of SF's "Bearded Boy Beer Bar" fear not folks you don't have to truck all the way to the Castro to get your pint filled by a rough and rugged type of man.  I wonder about their staffing. Looks like you can run the door (host) if you are a women but no tap pulling for you XX folks.  Why so few women working at the joint? The consistent lack of balanced staffing of this place makes me uncomfortable.

Jvm1-xPTwVkCsKSWYASQNA.review_text: Great beer selection!  Sour beer choices!  Yes, I said choices. They had three different sours!!  So tasty.   Taco Tuesday was perfect. Good tacos for a good price. I liked the fish cakes and the brat. The sauerkraut had a bit too much anise flavor but was still good.   Service was excellent. Very attentive and helpful. Noisy but what do you expect?  Dude asking for ID at the door DOES work there. Nice guy, he just caught me off guard. Didn't give me grief when I refused!  I will be back. They serve you whether or not you have a beard!

nkScY9gZ1NPvQ44ZpNrptw.review_text: I've been here a few times now, and I've enjoyed every visit.  The most important thing is: the staff knows their beer.  You tell them what you like, they'll find you a few things to expand your horizons.  They stock all kinds of beers, they make all kinds of beers, it's fantastic.  The food's really great, too, crazy good charcuterie and massive sausages.  Apparently I'm into head cheese, I didn't even know that 'til I tried theirs!  They make it themselves!  What bar makes head cheese??  Fantastic.  Staff are all courteous and charming, to boot.  Overall, definitely a great spot, and a really fascinating one in the context of the slow transformation of the 'Loin.  It'll be interesting to see how it stands after a year of operation--I hope it sticks around a long, long time!

t_ntCi7AXyy8adn4snmJew.review_text: To those that enjoy Mikkeller Bar: if you find yourself in Riverside and you want a similar experience, visit the Salted Pig.   Like: Ambiance - subdued lighting goes with the exposed brick and eclectic artwork  Beer selection - Yeastie Boys Porter. 10% ABV! Yakatori Chicken sausage dog - ...and I rarely eat hot dogs!  Wish: Greater food selection

BLdjU7aci4excf9LAd7mQw.review_text: I went here for the first time about a month ago. This place has an amazing selection at beers served at different temperatures ( I didn't know that was a thing). The food is alright. Mostly German fare. Not exactly my taste, but it was prepared well. Unfortunately, our waiter was extremely rude and I don't think I will be returning.

eKUGKQRE-Ywi5dY55_zChg.review_text: Mikkeller Bar is located in a very "colorful" part of San Francisco. By "colorful", I mean you can probably find the entire spectrum of poop and all colors of the unicorn piss on the nearby sidewalks. "Uhhh, where are you taking me?" asks Mr. NSS. "You said you were hungry weren't you?", I replied. "Yah but I want to keep my bunghole an exit not an entry", he said. "Don't worry, I have protection", I replied. Once you get past the seedy streets, you will find a yipster oasis at Mikkeller Bar. It's surprisingly spacious with rich dark woods and exposed brick walls. Seating is first come, first serve. By 5 pm on a Wednesday all the seats were taken at the booths, communal table, and at the bar so come early! Beer lovers will rejoice with the extensive beer menu. Hardcore drinks will *sigh* because there's no hard liquor offered. And, there's only two wine options, one white and one red. What brought me here were their Salt Cod Cakes which was on the 7x7's Big Eats List. If fish isn't your thing, they have an array of sausages but they come at a hefty price tag of $14 each! Yah, everything is expensive here. Also, on the menu are small bites (peanuts, olives, fries), charcuterie, mac & cheese, sandwiches and entrees (mussels, chicken). The Salty Cod Cakes ($12) were delicately crispy on the outside and moist on the inside: bit.ly/1xT8FDY. It's reminded me of crab cakes but more potent and saltier (not too salty). The dill, parsley, and lemon remoulade was delightfully creamy with just the right amount of citrus to cut through the richness. The salty cod cakes were good but not life-changing as 7x7 would make it out to be. Then again, that list is nothing but a marketing ploy IMO. We also ordered the S & P Fries ($6) which were served with a malt vinegar mayo and ketchup. Like solid fries should be, they were hot and crunchy throughout. The malt vinegar mayo was a standout and made this snack addicting. I ordered the only white wine they had which was a chardonnay for $10/glass. It was ok; refreshingly crisp to pair with the gastropub fare. I wish they had more wine options because not everyone is a beer drinker. Service was hipster fine; friendly but not overly so. We promptly received our food and drinks so no complaints. Mikkeller Bar is not a place I would come running back to because I'm not a beer drinker and the area is sketch especially at night. Then again, that's why I always carry protection: my barbie pink stun gun. Like boss.

WwmWdDCJREohcxQqfnOL-A.review_text: Had a great time here!   Happy hour with some friends after work. Had a Saison and really liked it. It's a beer drinkers bar and some of the beers are served at different temperatures. As someone who likes beers but doesn't know much about them, the menu was pretty intimidating. I wish they had some more descriptions for people like me who don't want to end up with something super hoppy or funky/bitter.   The food here was also good. The pickled veggies, frites, and half smoke were delicious!   Service took a while at first but they were pretty busy so I'll forgive that the initial drink order took a while.   Nice open bar area with tables in the front that seat 4-6 people. Crowd is definitely hipster/techie. Lots of flannel/plaid, beards, and "I (heart) TL" hoodies. Strange bedfellows hipsters/techies but they both love craft beers I guess :/

NRGJ4IvauajqqCbhT640cw.review_text: Besides the homeless man deucing into a sewer grate outside the place, this is what I look for in a bar these days. It's clean, there's plenty of room to sit, the staff is prompt and knowledgeable, and the beer.... oh, the beer. So much of it. Black, brown, red, blonde, sour, low/high abv, fruit, strange hybrids... it's all here and most of it is delicious. Reminded me of a brewery more than a bar. This is a spot to sit down and try a few new styles with a few friends.

9UokkqJpMj2pJ3bAgKehcQ.review_text: Yes, if you've ever been to Wurstkuche in LA, this place will remind you of it... but of course, it's not AS Good. This is almost at the edge of the Tenderloin so put your phones away!   Mikkeller bar is a first come, first serve type of seating. People usually stay here for a while because they have an assortment of beers. You might have to hover to get a spot. I don't recommend going downstairs to find seating because you're basically secluded from the rest of the world...  The bar is cute and very moderny, woodsy, cool sultry looking. We ordered the BRATWURST and the SAUCISSON A L'AIL. I am personally a fan of the latter because the dog was topped with caramelized onions. The fries were bomb but could be better with truffle fries.  This is a great place to go with a small group of friends since it gets packed on the weekdays. I can't imagine what it's like on the weekends!

8Ptqc0_12N5SjdGRiRbAAg.review_text: Mikkeller is a great place to sample the full spectrum of what beer can be. The character of the place is exemplified by the frequent inclusion of brews called "Beer Geek" on their menu. You will likely have not heard of most brews on their tap list. This is ok; pick something of your preferred style and you will probably like it.  Given the location, it is unsurprising that the crowd and venue are a bit more "downtown" than the typical Toronado set. In my times there I have nonetheless found it a relatively unpretentious place to hang out.

RDUe5SfDyxt79EV98cIbeA.review_text: One of the best beer selections in SF. Excellent food as well. Be sure to try the taco tuesday special.

LROD-o3VzPv9TvHI4jpn7g.review_text: Remarkably unpretentious place, it's hard for anyone who enjoys tasting the wide variety of flavors of beers to not smile with glee at the selection here. This is THE place to sample and savor flavors.  The on-draft selection is massive and the bottled selection even more-so. Both are constantly changing so I find it worthwhile to ask the staff about what's new. Speaking of the staff, they always make me feel welcome and are always willing to talk beer, give me suggestions, and bring samples for you to taste.   The last thing to note about the beer, which is something I've only encountered here, is that the on-draft selection is grouped into 'temperature' categories based on what temperature the kegs are kept at. Since this is a place to explore beer flavors this is perfect - keeping beer too cold hides the flavors. It's a small thing, but it shows that these guys really are passionate about their craft.  The atmosphere is designed for conversations - no TVs anywhere in the building! I've seen it a little too busy for my taste on a Friday night, but only barely (compared to what 'busy' means in most SF bars it's practically intimate).  They do also have some great food; everything I have had has been fantastic. Of special note is the Macaroni and Cheese with Bacon which has thick square chunks of bacon - unbelievably great. Overall, it's high quality heavy gastro-pub-grub which is appropriate given the reason you are here is to enjoy it with some (potentially heavy) beers.

BOxBlgoPK7J2XsNUz2aYgw.review_text: Went here on 11/9-11/10 for a friends birthday. As you can see im writing it at 2am the saturday night we got back. Lets see where to start, first the beer selection is VERY good, really rare stuff that is tasty. Overall we tried about 7 or 8 beers 3 of us ordered food and everyone thought the food was delicious. The house pastrami reuben that i had was BOMB. one of the best (if not best) reubens i have had in my life! well anyways if you are a craft beer lover or a craft beer virgin this place is for you!

KfaOtHe3vtnXo3i3pe4uSQ.review_text: Definitely the hip place to be. And a haven for craft beer lovers. They offer a cheese and charcuterie board for a lighter fare and we noticed the couple beside us ordering a massive meat plate, or should I say, assorted meats on a cookie sheet. Sausage heaven! Service is great and prices reasonable for the San Fran area.

Ku_WB7DnHaTfXrXwkhF6hA.review_text: What a weird and delightful place.  This location is in an odd part of town and you'll most likely miss it if you aren't paying close attention as you walk by. At least, that's what happened to me a time or two.  There beer menu was so funky and, at times, so expensive.  The appetizers (the only food I ventured into) were experimental and flavorful. Our waitress seemed apprehensive about us at first but finally warmed up toward the end of our stay and helped pick out some interesting beers to try.   If you like beer and dark-lit places, this might be a good spot for you.

GrktSJ7Bv9t37gwDLIlAwg.review_text: San Francisco is so lucky to have Mikkeller Bar. You can end your Mikkeller beer search now. There are 42 taps and good stuff flows though every single one. There's a Tenderloin series consisting of a Wit, IPA, Pils, Pale Ale, and others. There's a number of guest beers too, a bunch from San Francisco like Cellarmaker and Magnolia. Lots of sours featured here. Beautiful space with lots of tables, but odd narrow space behind the upstairs bar.

M6sULmDj2o-tGn2TGAOnzw.review_text: Door guy was a complete dick about my service dog.

aZrArKlx5GoObm4YlDQALA.review_text: The space is nice, and the service was friendly enough. The beer *list* was amazing... but the beer actually available for drinking? It was a serious subset of what was on the list. Out of the 6 beers my friends and I wanted to try, they were out of 4 of them. This despite the menu being labeled with with today's date, as if to assure you that they were certain everything would be there for you. For a place that prides itself on the draft beer list, missing about half of the list is a huge strike against. There are plenty of places with ~10 interesting beers on tap - Mikkeller, I thought you were joining a different crowd. And yeah, it wasn't unexpected, but $8 for a half-size beer is really too much. Won't be back, sadly.

AvC5XQAElcGAAn_Wr5auEg.review_text: Make your way past the seedy folks hanging out on the streets of the Tenderloin and you'll make your way to one of the best beer bars in the area -- Enter: Mikkeller.  The vibe and decor is perfect for grabbing a few beers with friends or co-workers. Tall bar tables, bar seating, and standing room make for a perfect setting. The beer menu and selection was impressive. 42 different styles. They had quite a few high-grav brews, too.   We also had dinner whilst drinking our beers. The verdict? I'd skip it next time The pretzel and reuben were both rather overdone and pretty boring. The breads on both dishes were so hard that I couldn't finish either. I'd imagine things would be much better if they were just more lightly finished in the oven.   But, hey. The good news is that beers and selection are both incredible. Prost!

7kPR3NAhl72EGbUU1h9FOw.review_text: I finally got around to having dinner.... oh gosh... dems some good fries, and the Rueben uh can I have two? Wow.   Their beer selection and the bartenders knowledge is legit too.

jiN_2P1xDsmw3MWX4U1fFQ.review_text: This place will fool you from the street. It is AMAZING once you're inside. Great beers and a very cool ambiance. One tip I would leave would be to get the untappd app and track the beers you drink. There are so many and it will be hard to keep track after a few visits. GREAT EXPERIENCE!

D4JHDISAtHlnaHf4jtvj8A.review_text: I like this place quite a bit. Came here one weeknight with a friend I was much overdue to catching up with. We were both so hungry. Drinks came out first. I had my first ever pumpkin ale here and it was a bit sour, but I really liked it. So good. Tables are shared tables with other people and then there a couple non communal ones. Food was okay. I wasn't thrilled with it, but I'd eat it. Great place if you love beer. They make it a point to serve it at the right temperature. I wish the waitress was more open to talking about the different beers with us, but it was busy, so I understand it. Absolutely love the interior of place. Would go back. It's not as good as The Hog's Apothecary in Oakland, but still decent.  Just a fyi: even though they are a restaurant too, you have to be 21 to enter. At least my friend and I were carded before we entered.

A9La_4Lju3u8PHSWQ5Vzyw.review_text: I like this place. It has a hip clean modern feel to it w/o being cold. It's a nice break from the piss and shit and litter that the homeless of SF generate. Good crowd too. More upscale than I've seen so far in San Fran.  The draught selection is well thought out except that they're lacking IPAs and beer should never be served in a pompous ass wine glass. Save those for the cork sniffers. The bartenders and GM are friendly and knowledgable.  I look forward to trying their specialty sausages and their reuben sandwich.

4T2uVlRjkl0eogswfL2bTA.review_text: This place is close to Union Square but does not seem to be too touristy!  It has an upstairs and downstairs, both crowded and noisy.   I went on a Friday night and it was nearly impossible to get a table or chair at the bar. Around 11 we were able to grab a table, however an hour earlier we ate standing up.   They have a huge selection of beer on tap! The food menu is limited, but I highly recommend the sausages. The sausage is huge :P and comes with a side of crispy crispy fries or salad. The salad had a tangy vinaigrette dressing, but it consisted only of  lettuce.    The wait staff is busy, but polite and helpful.   Overall I am glad I went, but this will not become my favorite hang out.

MHpn5NUAqb93SVXdXxZ-Rw.review_text: Really cool space. Modern decor, friendly atmosphere. I mean the beer is 5 out of 5 and it's pretty cool that the different types are served at different temperatures. I didn't get any grub here, but the menu looked promising.

yLtJfAaiaq536eRifTlarA.review_text: None too shabby. Had the beers...now I've been to the bar. Had  Fort Point WESTFALIA, Mikeller SPONTANCASSIS & Logsdon FAR WEST VLAMING..   I liked all 3. Met Rob from 4Pure brewery of Knightsbridge, London. We talked. I told him Derby County fc would crush Chelsea in the FA Cup fixture upcoming.   Eat: I had tempura cauliflower, with cranberries, butternut squash & faro risotto. Superb. I'm not a vegetarian.. but this dish made me consider it..for 3.3 seconds.

scH5Ju0cczmkPAKXDdyNHg.review_text: Cool spot & people watching out the front is second to none.

MsHH-CIQraaZ6suG6S5E9A.review_text: This place is as good as the area around it is bad.   Its a pretty huge, beer only, bar located in the TL. The beer selection is fantastic, I've never liked a beer as much as I liked the one I had that the bartender recommended. There are quite a few options, they change daily, so my advice is just to ask, because there's no way you're going to know everything, unless of course you spend your days researching different beers...   The crowd is typical financial district type, if everyone in the financial district was a woolly man who was overly enthusiastic about movember.

7I_Sifq_yQWaS8OH_88-bA.review_text: i was really impressed with this place.  there must have been 35+ beers on tap and it was a great, varied selection.  the servers were on it......i sat at the bar to get some work done and they were helpful in finding me a place to plug in and be comfortable....without being in the way.  at the bar, they serve by committee which speeds up the process.  i didnt go unattended at all and they were great at offering suggestions on beers to try.  the food was surprisingly good, much better than i expected.  i'll definitely be back when i am in town.    overall good vibe, the place was packed and seemed to hum along.

E0hnzH2Kx50pYjIOhMxfuA.review_text: Pros  A fantastic assortment of made in house drafts Great spot for beercentric folks A good amount of seating  Located 1 block from BART/Muni (although in the ghetto) Friendly and attentive service   Cons  Run out of things quickly No Salt Cod Cakes the night I went but will be back to try them (on 7x7 2014 Big Eat)  Overall Thoughts  A great place to grab a variety of quality drafts in a lively open atmosphere

ORYu-cLe0SxineXThaNuYA.review_text: Awesome gastropub hidden in Union Square! Great for trying new beers, but if you're looking for a quiet place to catch up, this would not the place for that.

qIDy9zJfCuqxy6A3exPe_w.review_text: 3.5 stars, for now.   Mikkeller Bar is a new gastropub that opened up. One plus is an extensive food menu.  I came in on a Tuesday night at 6pm. Tables had already pretty much filled up, so get there early if you have a party. I was able to snag the front section, and I put my name down on the host's iPad and he said I'd get a text when the table was ready. Awesome.  While you wait, you have complete access to order food and drinks, so it doesn't really matter where you sit. I ordered the evil twin low life pilsner, as recommended by the waitress. It was good. I also ordered the nuts (very smoky), sheep's milk cheese, and a stuffed pork/beef sausage. The food was mediocre. I wouldn't say it was the most amazing thing in the world. And why was my "stuffed" sausage look like a skinny hotdog? Not fulfilling at all, and it was $14. I could have purchased a larger hotdog outside for $1. Sad. The nuts get boring after a while... after all that smoky flavor, you have to wash that taste out of your mouth after a while.  I will say the wait staff is awesome, and there's an endless list of beers on tap to choose from, ranging from $6-8. Most people come here for the beer anyway, the food options are a plus if you're starving like I was. I was allowed to sit down with myself as I waited for my sister, which was another plus.  I would come back here again -- the vibe is good and they have a variety of tables and barstools to choose from.

QWxW_pApmpY9iPApC8P-UQ.review_text: Awesome place in SF to grab a beer.  Correct me if I'm wrong but I believe this is the first United States location to open as their microbrewery is located in Denmark.    Onto the beers... I don't quite remember the names of the beers but their beer is as a good as it gets.  All were flavorful and really puts you in a good mood.  They have a bunch of guest beers on tap as well, but I'd recommend you stick to their Mikellar line, that's why you're there to begin with right?  We also tried their fries and they were good, but make sure you tell them to make it extra crispy or else they come out a bit soggy.    5 stars.    ===================================  Note, the bar is located in a pretty sketchy part of the neighborhood.  There was broken glass scattered on the sidewalk and a dealer trying to slang their stuff.  It's not 100% hood, but I'd recommend you come here during the day when the sun is still out.

sg7GGGXYx3CEGcbtWZmpsw.review_text: Beer Selection is killer and the menu of mostly Sausage was decent. The decor took advantage of the vibe they are trying to create but it was a little cave like even in the middle of the day.  I am sure this place is soon to be run over by hipsters. But if you dare to venture close to the masses of Market St this is a great place to duck in and have a drink.

WlHwoHF3wXbDFnWgEMVt_A.review_text: Brought some cousins from SoCal here.   They loved it so much, they wanted to move here.   The sausages and french fries were delicious. Beer was delicious too.   Service was spot on and our waitress what was a good sport when I tried to pawn my brother off of her.   TRY IT!

tXhscxwFTd-ayLTdPx_2yA.review_text: I like beer, this bar takes beer seriously.  They have an extensive and variant selection of beers from all over the world on tap and they are served perfectly in terms of carbonation, temperature, etc. That makes the beer taste very good. Pair this with very nice staff and we have a winner.  The place isn't super nice, but it's okay inside, the beer and staff make it special and I'll be back many times. I don't know why this took me so long to get around to!

09xTj2gncIWeL1uWlxF3XQ.review_text: Excellent.  Superb hide-a-way from the blight and disgrace outside.

4IEt7Yucgh3LF_0jcAnD5w.review_text: Not a good bar. Many exotic brews I was hoping to enjoy -- some of my favorites which up to now I have only been able to come across in Belgium. Unfortunately, the experience is sadly lacking, for the following reasons: 1. The decor is sterile -- no warmth or charm whatsoever. 2. Beers are served improperly -- everything in the same small (.25L) chablis glasses. 3. They don't post the beers where you can see what is offered; you have to seek out a hard-to-find beer menu. 4. Rather than seat or serve you, the wait staff directs a newcomer to the back wall behind the bar, where other patrons give conflicting advice on how to actually secure a glass of beer. Additional attributes which don't bother me, but might bother some: 5. Location -- in the T-lion, not Union Square. 6. Very expensive -- $7.50 to $14.00 I hope this revised review escapes the criteria for Yelp filtration -- I've done my best to be gentle.

ssuWkMne1wQ6_WmxmXhl5Q.review_text: I enjoy a nice Mikkeller or Mikkeller collaboration just as much as the next guy and was pretty excited to visit the bar on my whirlwind beer tour of sunny but breezy San Fran.   Unfortunately, what I had envisioned this establishment to be like vs. what it actually is like, were two very different mental images.   The design both in front and behind the bar is chic and minimalist, if you can imagine what I mean by that.  I appreciated that aspect of it.  The bar was also much more spacious than I was expecting.  Not exactly a selling point for me.  The clientele, a mix of self important hipsters and loud bougy 30-somethings, really ruined the experience for me.  There were a number of beers on tap, however, my first pick was already kicked.  Any who knows Mikkeller should know that you won't find their beer in a store for under $5/ bottle, therefore don't expect to pay less than almost double that for most of the brews on tap.  Price doesn't factor into my rating at all.  Also, this bar unfortunately borders the Tenderloin neighborhood.  Please refer back to my Hilton Union Square review for a LMGTFY link in case you are not familiar with the Tenderloin.  I really wanted to like the bar.  Maybe I'll give it another try my next time through town.

zmX7__tijMZaJqOwESYa2A.review_text: This place seems like it is a little overrated as a "Gastro pub". The beer selections are amazing. With approximately 24 beers, there's always some type of beer that you will like. If you like wine and do not like beer, You will not like this place.   there was very little food that was on their menu so I would not classify this is a Gastro pub. The almonds that they had as an appetizer were stale, moist and unappetizing. The french fries were overdone.  This place, however, seems to be a very good place for a social get together to have a couple of beers. It seems very trendy is in the tenderloin and not a great part of it. There seem to be a very significant upscale yuppie crowd of urban professionals having drinks after work.

mYBiSHPYzmei_cMBSibpzQ.review_text: Guys. Guys. Guys.  I seriously can't stop raving about this place. In the past month I've been here three times, one on a random Wednesday night, the second for a date, and the third for their opening weekend brunch (pairings by Mission Chinese). That first time was when they were still in soft opening, and a friend made me check it out on the basis of one rumor. He drove up from San Carlos, he was so excited.  Interior is beautiful and selection has been amazing every time. Pricy, for sure, but when I get the chance to try crazy shit like elderflower sour beers I am flat up in heaven. Actually, whenever there's a tap list that changes daily and has any sort of solid selection of funky and sour beers I'm in heaven. But this place goes above and beyond.  Food is good and bartenders are super friendly. I've had their cheese platter and while I generally shy away from complimentary almonds (for this specific plate) they were smoked and seriously the bomb. I hate nuts, but I loved these.  Only con: location. Bouncers at door and there's never an issue directly in front but I've been made a little uncomfortable walking back and forth to my car.  tl;dr: Absolutely worth the visit, but be wary of the location and expect beer to be on the pricier side. You're going to try some amazing things that you won't find elsewhere.

3928NBSrZ0cbVfdmhi-R-Q.review_text: Really nice space and great beer menu. There were only a few things missing:  1) Should have had Danish ketchup with the fries. Danish ketchup is SO good, better than Heinz, and it's a Danish brewery/bar, so why did they serve Heinz?   2) They should serve Danish hot dogs, which are also wonderful.  3) They should do tastings. I wanted to try everything in small quantities, but they only served by the glass.  I will definitely come back. Would consider having an event here.

yvMMklXORyL9YaU3cXsvzQ.review_text: Love it here science of beer

bDga4MH5qZ7syPWI-FVeBg.review_text: Awesome tap and bottle selection.  Place has a nice feel but can be busy.  Admittedly I've only been here during busy times...  I mark it down 1 star for three things- the prices are a tad high, the food isn't as good as it could be, and the service (when busy) is really flustered and lacking.  If you like an awesome beer selection (and an emphasis on sours as I enjoy), check this place out!

sT1_LD-6HJ_34DyMjwPGmQ.review_text: Way overpriced beer, 10$ for 33 CL glass, Bavarian pretzel harder than a rock, little piggies wrapped in bacon- no flavor and burned, roast beef sand which meat had no flavor either- the kale on the Sammie had more flavor than the meat, way cooler non pretentious places to go to get good micro brews and food at a reasonable price, don't understand the fanfare at all with this place. Cauca.

SdnVwgoBtB8fmEaTNbipHQ.review_text: Everything about this place is amazing! Best Ruben Sando I have ever eaten, seriously! Creme brule with coffee cocoa and chili pepper stout, oh yes!

7Ek4da_Btvznc4Q4S0_Bag.review_text: Outstanding experience with beer, beautiful venue, love the downstairs too. On a Saturday afternoon it took  *** FOR EVER ***  to get service. I would avoid this place any time but in off hours for that reason, but I'm a curmudgeon.

awIHeee0mCbn_44DQDJV1g.review_text: Mikkeller Bar was a must stop for us while we were visiting San Francisco.  We got there early before 5:00pm and grabbed a seat at a communal table.  It's a comfortable modern Gastropub.  We ordered olives & spicy peanuts to snack on & a couple of beers.  We stuck with the Mikkeller beers although they had many guest taps. I ordered the Mikkeller Tenderloin Ale. My husband ordered the Mikkeller Tenderloin IPA.  I'm not usually an IPA drinker but I liked this one.  It's similar to Lagunitas IPA, not too hoppy.  Our waitress was friendly & attentive.  We'll definitely be back when we're back in the Bay Area.  Luckily we won't have to wait to enjoy their beers since we have had their collaborations & Mikkeller beer in Los Angeles.

mP8ARpTL6DZPdA_YV--ybQ.review_text: My coworkers and I had many excellent beers here tonight and our waiter was excellent too - kudos to Andrew on not only providing great (and polite) service while we were there, but shared his newfound enjoyment of beer (being a "wine guy" and all).  One of my coworkers is quite the beer connoisseur and even he hadn't had a lot of the selections on the beer menu. We're coming back out in August and are looking forward to returning and trying out their latest selections.

ChI__xJ2Jm8z0xp3HsyADA.review_text: Always loved Mikkellar. What a beautiful experience! A must try if you're in the San Fran Area!

IfanXVYDpduyvMEi7-A-bw.review_text: I'm in love with Mikkeller.  They have a huge list of unbelievable beers on tap. They have relationships that allow them to get beers you would not expect on tap like Jolly Pumpkin and Three Floyds.  Also, Cantillion? Check!    When I went there the other day I got the Mikkeller lambic with cassis and that was a good move.  Followed up by splitting a 750ml bottle of Cantillion lambic mixed with raspberries that was unbelievable!  It reminded me of touring Cantillion in Belgium, which was one of the most profound beer moments in my life!  Y'all should checkout Mikkeller.  Come for the beer, stay for the fries.  Otherwise don't get food here unless you're willing to spend for it.  Now drink up you crazy kid!

lYp818T-xh8Ss79To5Azhw.review_text: A tasty brew and sausage are enough, in my book, to warrant four stars. Label me Easy, I don't mind. I'm a red-blooded American male and my joys can be wrought from the simplest of pleasures. Feed me, souse me, I'm immediately your cuddle buddy, I'm delirious. I'm setting a benchmark, here, and guess what? Label my mark Easy.  By the same token, if you wanna charge me eight or nine bucks a pint, all of a sudden my nose turns decidedly northward. Swill will be discerned. And to be fair, the cost of my Saucisson a l'ail wasn't entirely warranted; delicious, sure, and that mustard was International, but in the end it was just a sausage and the side salad was, well, a side salad.   None of that mattered. The beers up in here are absolutely stupid pristine. I tasted five varietals (yes, they deserve the same verbiage as wine) and sipped two pints, the experience was beyond enlightening. Oh Jaysus, the cask ales simply soak in the goodness. I could literally taste the whiskey and port in the barreled pours; the imperial stouts were a little too powerful for my overwhelmed palate, but incredible nonetheless; in their totality, the pours werre nuanced, artisinal and absolutely crunk. So are the dope slingers who pour 'em. The staff was incredibly knowledgeable and understandably patient, which is so important for an ol' boy from the boonies who couldn't decide what to order in the first place.  Gastropub appropriate? Agreed. The menu probably doesn't qualify. But the beer? Every pour had a nose, and every sip offered the sublime. Beer heaven indeed, Brittany.

vHLlodnwPXIhBGkZs-MV5w.review_text: While walking to this place a man yelled "welcome to the jungle!" That is confirmation that you are definitely in the TL. This place is still really close to Westfield so the location is not that bad. It's fairly new so it still looks very clean and nice inside. Great customer service. We ordered the cheese platter and the Lil smokies along with a dark and a light beer. Everything was delish! I want to go back to try their other food.

wKPSHbz603kqaAXm-Fw9hg.review_text: Loved this place will definitely be back.  Great beer selection, we had a rhubarb gose which was divine.  Excellent food choices for a bar.    Sadly, in a really depressing and depressed neighborhood.  Consider having some ones handy for the homeless if you are so inclined.

vLDWwcgRcLTrpHNNQPtnCQ.review_text: Love this spot! Lots of beers that are rare to find in, and even more so on tap. The bar wraps around the whole space, and allowed for everyone to be comfortable. Bartenders are very knowledgeable and helpful. Good spot to grab a drink in the Union Square area.

teTNl__Z0o3L6mTj5wxD8A.review_text: This review has nothing to do with the beer. They have an incredible selection all served at the proper temperature for each style. This review has nothing to do with the food. The menu is limited but the food is above average for a place like this. Nothing amazing but good quality and well prepared. I little expensive for what it is but this is downtown SF after all.   I went to Mikkeller last Saturday with a group of friends. We'd all been there several times before. We all liked the place, that's why we keep going back. This review has to do with the service we received.   The place was packed. We squeezed into a tiny space at the bar. We were finally able to order beers. The friend who was closest to the bar was handing each of us the beer we ordered as they were placed on the bar. As he reached for his, the fifth and final beer he inadvertently knocked it over. He immediately got the attention of bus staff and even helped them to wipe up the mess. He then asked an employee behind the bar if he could get another beer. To which he was told no by a gentleman who identified himself as the general manager. When we asked for his name we were told Bob Demoise. Bob said "you paid for a beer, I served you a beer" When my friend politely pressed the issue he said "if I pour you another, I'm out a beer." All five of us were floored. First of all,  unless his last name is Mikkeller he's not out anything. Second of all, it's common practice in the restaurant business to replace a spilled drink.  So yes, the general manager saved his employer a six dollar beer (which probably cost them $2). He also lost 5 regular customers who will never be back. Figuring that each of us spends 40-50 everytime we go, that $6 beer just cost Mikkeller bar thousands of dollars over the next few years. Penny wise, pound foolish.  I own a retail business. I can't tell you how many times I've replaced something for a customer that they broke or damaged. I didn't have to, but I knew if I didn't, I'd risk losing their future business. Hundreds of dollars later is worth much more than $10 today. I guess being in SF and having tons of tourists as customers you can treat them like crap, they'll never be back anyways. But we live here. . . .now we won't be back either.

O13YdpM9qFqnp1NbjTBNsg.review_text: Don't love the area but loved the bar. Very new and sleek on the inside. The bar tenders are kind of snobby but if you know what you like, they'll help you find some pretty fun beers to taste - and let you try as many as you like. Prices are a bit high but expected for nice beer. Really enjoyed our night here :)

4Y81J2Tdq5XAnkeYmCZ2ow.review_text: This beer bar is girly-girl approved! They've got wine -- 2 reds and 2 whites, a super decent food menu, and a tres chic ambiance with lots of room for groups and solo drinkers at the bar. So, next time the boyfriend suggests Mikkeller, I won't put up a fight. At all.  Obviously, they've got a bunch of classy beers with Mikkeller's own brews highlighted. The Lambicus single-yeast wild ale was incredible! Not too heavy, bitter, or sour. Just lovely.   For food, I had the organic chicken two ways (breast & braised thigh) with cheesy grits and chili jus. Perfect beer-pairing meal for $16. We also ordered some sausages ($14), which looked pretty epic. And the fries...ideal. Thick & belgian style with ketchup & aioli. Yep, aioli is now a standard accoutrement in SF.   Service was smooth, though prices are a little steep for a beer bar. But! For this neighborhood, it's worth paying a little extra for the classy, spacious digs and quality sips, I think.

2_cYY6CX82oblZZDC1MOpQ.review_text: I've been waiting for Mikkeller Bar SF to open, and it didn't disappoint. The space is beautiful and well-planned, with plenty of places to sit and stand. It's at the edge of the Tenderloin, so you go straight from sketchy to wood and metal European-style awesomeness.   The beer is delicious, and every style imaginable is on tap. The cookie plate was meh on its own, but I couldn't pass up the chance to have Milk Stout and cookies. They have sours on tap now, but I'll definitely be back when the sour room is finished.
