Note for the ladies -- Mikkeller has arguably the best bar bathroom in SF. Spacious and nice. I have to give them the fifth star for being straight classy, makes me want to blindfold out-of-town visitors and deposit them directly in the bar.

UEtIK4iVQA99vqMALyKtEg.review_text: 4.5 stars!  On weekends, go before 3 as there is ample seating at the bar. On hot days, come in here, tons if ceiling fans & cellar temperatures + cold beer. Win win!  Their beers are all good. Bring your snooty beer friend here and they will be impressed. I am knocking off 1 star because that place gets CRAZY CROWDED! There's seating downstairs, but that's not where the action is, so unfortunlately the secret is out w/ this place.

p3heVCnq3M0H2LMxIuuc5g.review_text: I really wanted to like this place, but in the end it was an A-OK experience.  Simply put, it was not the beer hall Valhalla I was hoping for.  The Great: + Top notch selection of draft beers.  I was particularly impressed by their selection of sour beers (my current mania). + It's a cool space. + Nice fries! + The Bratwurst and the "Half Smoke" sausages were spot on.  The Average: o Average prices per oz on the beer.  There were definitely some better values on the menu, but overall the pricing was A-OK. o The staff were hit or miss.  Some seemed fake, one lady bartender was fantastic, and our server at the table was helpful but was slightly irritated all night. o The rest of the sausages were just OK.  The Poor: o  The price on the food was over the top.  $14 sausages ($17 w/ a side)?!  $16 Reuben (small)?!   o  Salt, salt, and more salt.  My wife and I split the Reuben and it was quite possibly the saltiest thing I've ever had.  The salt made my lips burn and tingle.  I had to drink almost an entire carafe of water just to make it through my half of sandwich.  The flavor was decent, but the salt simply ruined it. o  Crawling w/ Hipsters.  I am glad that this wonderful city can support places like this, and I hope they continue to do well.  I may be back, but this time only to drink.  Beer Selection: 5 Stars Beer Price: 3 Stars Food Selection: 3 Stars Food Taste: 2 Stars Service: 3 Stars

eGs6GlsMG9hTRVnYyEk16Q.review_text: Mikkeller Bar is a yuppie's beer-and-small-plates dream, and that's probably why it was very crowded on a Friday night. The interior is hipster chic and features high ceilings and exposed brick, so don't be thrown off by the Tenderloin location.  There is open bar seating both on the ground floor and the basement; the downstairs bar is a bit hidden, but keep walking past the bathrooms and you'll find a quieter, bright room. They told us it was an hour wait for a 3-person table, but our table was ready in 20 minutes. It was not much of a table, more like awkward seats hovered around a knee-high metal block, but it got the job done.  We had the Prince Edward Island Mussels ($12) and the Sriracha Chicken Wings (~$13). The pickled onions and chorizo with the mussels were tasty, but the actual mussels themselves were quite small. The chicken wings were spicy, but I wouldn't necessarily say they emphasized the unique Sriracha flavor.  I'm not a beer person, but my friends' beer (recommended by the waiter) was very interesting and had an aftertaste that was reminiscent of popcorn. Cider here is very overpriced (bottled, yet each is ~$12), so I wouldn't recommend it. Bring your casually pretentious, craft-beer-loving friends to Mikkeller, and they will be impressed!

3d6yGe8VKs7gt5b7hXw5xQ.review_text: Came here after getting a recommendation from a friend. They have great beer on tap which for me taste better than the bottled. (depends on the beer, style ect. ) The food was great! Got house made sausages and fries were yummy! Make sure to come early cause you might have to wait cause it can get busy but thats a sign they are doing something right!

P5bUL3Engv-2z6kKohB6qQ.review_text: I've been to the original Mikkeller bar in Vesterbro, Copenhagen, which is a really cool place. The SFism of the bar is very apparent here as it's a totally different place and vibe. Speaking of the latter Im sure because it was opening night, it was packed to the gills. Luckily we didnt have to deal with any line since we went and had dinner first. Ran into a bunch of folks I've seen before. Ex servers at Atelier Crenn/Trappist, one of the Trappist Co owners, and some folks from Saison. It was a crazy mix of food industry, hipsters and beer lovers all around. The bar and food seating were packed all night so we missed getting any food. Walking up to the central bar the staff were pretty sharp and got my order right away. Spontanale, Mikkeller Tripel, and the Lil' Mikkeller is what we had. Having just come back from Belgium and Copenhagen recently, it was a good reminder of what I just left. The selection is excellent and there are many things to try including the food. Looking forward to it mellowing out a bit after a while before I go back though. Still an excellent debut. Certainly anticipating all the brews to come.

E5bpjNOJBY56Mzy14s25Hg.review_text: Good beer. Decent prices. Gets quite crowded after work so get there early.   Bad: extremely unflexible. I was with someone who doesn't eat pork. And they wouldn't substitute a non pork sausage (same price as the pork sausage) on the lunch special.   We asked and explained that the guest did not eat pork. And he said too bad that's the way it is.   I hate places with jerk waiters. It wasn't busy. It was pretty empty inside.   Oh well. My money will go elsewhere. Too bad because I like the beer.

cufhYFdyrUAt4SWe-m0grQ.review_text: When Jelena Z suggests you check out a beer bar, you check out the beer bar. Beer lovers, you have your spot (well, yet another one in a beer-rich city like SF). When I first discovered (or, 'was led') to Mikkeller, the word hadn't gotten out. They'd recently opened and seats were plentiful. Not so much anymore. The good thing is that the wait is not so long as to drive you mad but if you'd been here before, say, last September and you're just now returning, you're going to be in for a surprise. People have spread the word and the people who are here are thirsty... which is good because there's plenty of good beer.  The taps run the gamut from light to dark and the staff is knowledgeable about what's good for every particular taste. I've enjoyed wild ales, brown ales, Goops (not related to Her Boniness), as well as all the typical tastes (served in the proper glassware) one would expect. If you don't find what you're looking for on tap (sad trombone) opt for a bottle selection. It's just as vast. But, there's more! Food. While I would never suggest coming to Mikkeller for dinner, eating while you're here's not a bad idea. To compliment your beer, look into the cheese plate (decently imaginative selection with accompaniments) or the pork sausage made with garlic & caramelized onions, served with fries and salad. The price is right. It tastes good and the selections pair very nicely with whatever beer is curing what ALES ya.* But, if you're just in the mood to sit in a dark (not so quiet anymore) bar, drink excellent beer, talk to a good friend, or just be one with your thoughts, you (and the rest of SF) will want to come here to do so.  *I'm a regular comedian.

jj7qARHi2gfTZY87v2RQsw.review_text: it's great to have a nicer bar in this neighborhood. I've been to Mikkeller four or five times now and have never been disappointed. the beer menu is extensive, the servers seem to know the beers well and the food is great. the sausage platter is well worth it. might seem expensive at $45 but with an order of fries, it's a meal for three people or apps for more. it gets crowded so if you're planning to meet there with a group, the earlier the better. I'm not sure if they take reservations, but there are big tables which seat 6 or 8 people, and a few times we got there earlier enough to snag one.

WWnhqRnWWjutMqh-2SzEuQ.review_text: I took a short trip to the Bay recently, and met my friend Jon P. at the Powell BART station, backpack in hand. We went to Mikkeller Bar for a 4:00 drink and ended up having to run to the Ferry Building for a 6:00 engagement. We completely lost track of time in this wonderful bar.  Mikkeller has a gorgeous space, with light wood and brick and cool whimsical art on the walls. It's large with several tables and a central bar, with counter seats facing a formidable line of forty-two taps. We sat front and center at the main bar, and service was great.  The beer selection is tremendous, featuring a wide range of Mikkeller's own beers, as well as interesting beers from around the world. It was my first time at Mikkeller's, so I stuck with their brand for my two rounds. I had the Tenderloin IPA and the Beer Geek Brunch Weasel. Both were outstanding. The IPA was top notch, substantial and hoppy, and the Beer Geek Brunch Weasel was a delicious, rich imperial oatmeal stout brewed with civet cat coffee (that super expensive coffee that comes out of a cat's ass). Jon had the Bavik Petrus Aged Pale Ale and the De Struise Cuvée Delphine, which were both unique and tasty. The Petrus was a sour, which isn't really my thing, but it was great for a sip. The Cuvée Delphine was firmly up my alley, a full-bodied stout brewed in a bourbon barrel. All our beers came with perfect heads of foam. Either the taps are special or the bartenders particularly artful.  We munched on some meat and cheese to avoid getting too drunk, and this was a nice snack. We had prosciutto, pork rillettes, and Valdeon blue cheese, and all were fantastic. The platter came with toast, almonds, mustard, cornichons, and like a sweet/spicy fruit chutney. Meat and cheese portions weren't particularly big, but there was plenty to munch on and it was all good.  Mikkeller's has a full food menu, and I'd love to come back to eat and drink. I could've stayed at this place all night. The beer and atmosphere were just perfect.

DyB0bvGhaPX27mPyWZFO_Q.review_text: Located a short walk from the BART Powell Street station, Mikkeller Bar is a fantastic gastropub specializing in house made sausages and a unique selection of beers on tap. Mikkellar Bar prepares to celebrate its one year anniversary on Saturday, Aug. 9. Here are a few reasons why you should visit:  LIL' SMOKIES ($13): bite size pieces of hot dog wrapped in bacon, mild Chipotle BBQ sauce on the side. Simple appetizer, done right. Excess oil had been drained off, each bite was hot but not scalding hot as to singe my lips. Great bar food.  ST. BERNARDUS PRIOR 8 ($9): long one of my favorite Belgium ale's, it was served oddly enough in a wine glass. Not sure what that's about, but it was served appropriately at cellar temperature.  DE STRUISE BOUWERS BLACK ALBERT ($13): One of the best Belgian beers available right now. At 13% ABV, it's also meant to be enjoyed at a leisurely pace. Once again, the bartender served the beer appropriately at cellar temp.  The bartenders were cool and, as noted in the correct serving temps of both my beverages, know their beers well.   Final tips:  -There are a handful of gluten-free beers available, as listed on the parchment looking menu -Check out the Draft List- Several local brews available, many unique to Mikkellar -Lunch special daily from 12-4 pm: Beer & Brat for $12.

MxaaFrjsn3TWPbHhPey29g.review_text: Okay if you're already in the neighborhood.  My review is from Friday, 8/9/13. I dipped out of work early to snag a spot before it got crowded, only like 2 million people had the same idea.  It was swamped by 5:30, but I got a drink at the bar only moments after I approached it.  Beer selection is good.  And if you know what you want, you can jump in front of the 50 people staring down at their phones for UnTapped ratings. :D It took around 45 minutes  to seat our party of two.  The service was pretty bad but our server was earnest--that was expected since they just opened.  Long waits between seating, ordering, check etc.  The charcuterie platter is pretty good, the liver dip (not sure what it's actually called) tastes too bile-y.  They should consider teamwork/shared tips to handle big crowds.  At any given time there were 5 people standing around wearing Mikkeller Bar shirts, but when we asked for help they'd give us the look-off or say our waitress is coming.  Just put my order in! Jeez!   I probably won't make this spot a destination, but I would be happy to stop in when I ever find myself wandering the back alleys of Civic Center.

sqbbNzMvV0gel_al3dOY5w.review_text: 50 well chosen craft beers on tap. Foods unexpectedly good. We had the meat and cheese platter. Bring your wife or girlfriend and she will think your in the know

u6wH6ZguY90vOnfIPkHswQ.review_text: Went last night with a co-worker/friend. we tried about 8 beers between the 2 of us, about 1/2 were great, 1/4 good and the remaining 1/4 not the best. I'm not much of a beer drinker though so was less informed in my choices and had a very good but "beer novice" server. The stouts were all pretty yummy, tried 3 and don't recall the names, sorry. If you like dark beers you are not likely to go wrong.   The food was pretty great. Had PEI mussels, not for pesci's as there is crumbled bits of house-made sausage in the dish, along with S&P fries - great combo and prob the best mussels i've had. Spicy Italian "stuffed in house" sausage sandwich - super tender and flavorful. Sour cherry bread pudding - out of this world; only dessert on the menu but owner's wife is a pastry chef so it is no joke.   8 beers between the 2 of us and these yummy foods for right over $100, great deal. good food, good service, nice understated industrial beer garden decor. Definitely worth stopping by. If you're like us you'll cancel your other reservation for later that night or just may forget to show up! :)

5qgJTus1l35A6bqW2fFk0w.review_text: I love the space, it's a lot larger than other taprooms/bars that specialize in beer in the city (other than Southern Pacific) and I like the open seating policy (you can just grab a table or a seat whenever it becomes available.  I'm on a sour beer kick, so I started with a sour white that was on tap and then tried another at the recommendation of our really helpful (and knowledgeable) waitress.  She brought out a taste of the beer before I purchased it, which was an awesome touch and had a definite opinion on what each of us would like based on what we had been drinking previously.  I definitely would love to come back here to try more beer off of their changing and very extensive menu (winter beers I'm looking at you :)!!)   Minus one star for the very okay food.  The almonds were, kind of weird to be honest.  They're usually very rich and herby, and these ones almost tasted chalky and really did not play well with the beers I was drinking.  The Cauliflower tempura was good, but had HUGE granules of cracked pepper in it, which my girlfriend kept crunching on and thinking they were rocks.  My other friend got the B.E.L.T (BLT with an egg) and said the same, way over peppered, and nothing amazing.    In short-come for the beer!  And have a Lyft/Sidecar/Uber/Cab waiting for you when you leave b/c sh*t gets weird around there after the sun goes down. For real.

AINlhpAQJevVmPiHQsgcwg.review_text: I came here last week on a date with a beer expert, so my experience might be colored a bit.  They have a wonderful selection of (decently priced) sour beers, and a high-end-but-not-obscene gastropub menu. The cheese plate and cod cakes were tasty, salty foils to the puckering brews, but we probably shouldn't have gotten the pickled veggies- too much sour.  Come out for great beers and some light nosh in a cool atmosphere, but your money will probably go further elsewhere if you're just looking for a nice dinner.

P7wW1vldAFMeAeCHj8TGRA.review_text: They appear to have connected the pils spout to the IPA keg. I know the difference. The waiter clearly did not. He gave me a big speech about how they make a crazy pils that tastes and looks just like an IPA. Well guess what, d-bag? I've had the Mikkeller Pils in a bottle and it looked and tasted like a friggin' pils.  You people owe me a beer... not that I'll be back to that overpriced den of arrogance.

F4Ec6wRe3Eewiz84PkhwkA.review_text: Pretentious atmosphere.  I had to ask how to order a beer as the bartenders seemed to only deal with tickets from a middle man. A bartender pimp, if you will. Got a seat after wandering around for 15 minutes and 15 minutes later we had out order taken. Beers took another 15 minutes and the food another 5.   Coconut beer didn't taste like coconut. Tasted like overpriced ipa. Meh.   $16 pork sandwich was a mess. Bread didn't hold up, but we were not given any cutlery. Green stuff in sandwich made it more difficult to eat and I had to pull out. Fries were nothing special. Pork was good, but the sandwich form factor ruined it. Perhaps tacos?  Bacon fried hot dogs made me crave the ones from the mission, only ate one tiny bite.  Avoid.  They call them something else.   Not good value or anything really. Did find cool bar next to which was good.

OqH85SAF0oLijVY_SeAk8A.review_text: Tons of beer on tap, super friendly bartenders, and delicious house made sausages (think it was the Mettwurst). I would pass on those chicken wings and fish cakes though.. a bit salty for my taste. The space is beautiful, clean, and hopefully will rub off on the surrounding area.. but I doubt it. I've had no trouble so far, but it's always nice to walk with other people when leaving later in the evening. It's pretty packed during after work hours, so if you want a table it might be a small wait, but I've also been here on a Sunday night and it was perfectly mellow.  I always forget how strong the beer is. Yum.   Price -- it's pricey. Wish they had a wider price range of beers. But, really good/tasty specialty beers.  Bartenders -- super friendly and helpful. No dead eyes or gruff service here.

HvQkBkPYmoX3HnEGj_TMXw.review_text: Plenty of beer selection for any avid beer drinker. Food and service was mediocre. After about 10 minutes for my beer, I ordered the mikkeller burger with a side salad. The salad was not bad but the burger came out well done when I ordered medium and the bun was cold and slightly hard. The overall atmosphere and vibe is great but id recommend coming here for a beer instead of the food.

q16FcvZyP5SURJEX8iGcTg.review_text: extensive beer selection, but limited with wine.  5 stars because of the awesome bar food.  we ordered a sausage platter, cured meats, and olives.  I'm not a beer drinker, but all my friends enjoyed what they ordered.  Place can get crowded and people were actually waiting for a seat in the lobby area.  downside -- horrible neighborhood. Luckily, it was only a block from Powell St.

NLOT2HT_X75IZTrc_qy6DA.review_text: Great brew list and fantastic food! The Bratwurst is terrific. Fantastic, friendly service!! Highly recommended.

lJcUAW61FQbr9_5mHYC6vQ.review_text: I went to Mikkeller for the first time last week (a Wednesday around 8) with a couple beer loving friends. Everything was awesome - obviously amazing beer selection, really great decor and atmosphere, and clearly a popular place already.   Unfortunately my friends and I are probably never going to come back after how rudely the unprofessional hostess treated our group. The four of us waited at the front podium for about 5 minutes for the hostess, since clearly it was a busy night and we wanted to get a table and order food. After she didn't appear, we wandered inside, where a waitress confirmed for us that we should wait by the podium. The hostess had by then returned and was talking to a group of 3 who had just come in. After taking their name down, she took ours. I informed her politely that we had arrived before the group of 3, which the waitress we spoke with confirmed to her. She just stared at me and sort of nodded. I asked what we should do in the meantime and she said to find a seat in the back and that she would come get us when a table opened up.  Unfortunately that never happened. The group of 3 was seated directly next to us in the back, and after coming and flirting with them repeatedly, the hostess took them to a table after about 40 minutes of waiting. She never once looked at us or acknowledged our presence, or the fact that we had been waiting longer. We waited in vain for another 20 minutes before giving up and leaving.  I totally get that this place is new and probably working out some kinks. I'd recommend they hire a more professional hostess as a part of that process. Till then, we're definitely not coming back.

82dCHyU-ANOgdhxUgZsUeg.review_text: I stumbled upon this place while looking for somewhere not too touristy to eat in downtown San Francisco. It's a beer spot that serves food that goes well with beer (like sausages). The atmosphere is wooden with dim lights.  I ordered the milk stout in a bottle because a lot of people were talking about it on Yelp. I don't know why that let me ignore my rule of always getting something on draught when it's there. Draught is always preferable to me because it's more rare--a bottle can be more ubiquitous since it's a easy-to-ship-bottle. Anyway, I thought that this packaged beer was alright. Maybe it was because it was served slightly warmer than I think it should have been. It's like when you put in a bottle in a refrigerator for about 30 minutes and the outside of the container is cold but the core of the item is not yet.  The sausage I got was tasty. The fries were more memorable. The prices are decent. I wouldn't mind trying this place out again if I'm looking for a beer/food refuge in downtown SF.

217YRDF4p01GevULQ0n4RQ.review_text: I want to give this place a better review because the beer, food and decor are really great.  However, the service (at least the service we received) could really use some improvement.  Our waitress almost knocked me over with a shove she used to navigate the bar, was disinterested in actually serving our food/drinks, and was generally very rude.  Most people ended up ordering at the bar, but our small table tab still had a 20% gratuity added that we felt was highly undeserved.  The manager, to his credit, understood the situation and removed it from the bill when asked.

pV5_rdfNhNGKtY6P9ILZUw.review_text: Dutch style pub in the heart of Union Square? I didn't even know there was such a thing until I accidentally found it while trying to meet friends at 50 Mason.  Seriously though, the most delicious beer I had all month. The beer menu was a little overwhelming at first, but a quick Tenderloin Pils and not the worst bratwurst I've had later, I wasn't so scared. I will try more beers next time. The meal was decent, but a bit overpriced, that brat. It was like, $15 for a sausage on a bun and a medium amount of okay fries. Someone near me got the mussels and I was kind of regretting not doing the same when I saw them come out. Still, the brat was decent and the crispness of that Pils made it all worth while. I will be back.

UM7l0shhmjxE3m3wV-n34A.review_text: I was here friday night with a few friends.  The place was packed but the service was ok.  I was impressed with their selection but the beers were very expensive.  I paid $17 for two beers.  Bot the beers I had were ok but nothing special.

WfePuaS_iXGNGU6bfDe3JQ.review_text: Beer Stop 46 ----  After realizing that Mikkeller was having a soft opening, my girlfriend and I quickly changed our flight to come here. It was glorious - in fact, this is my second favorite beer bar in the US. Coincidentally, the first one is Evil Twin.  Even though there was a wait and the place was packed, the servers were awesome. The tap list was incredible - La Rulles Tripel, Mikkeller Tripel, and Mikkeller I Hardcore You were standouts.  The bottle list was small at the time, but that should improve as they open.   As far as food, just tried fries and wings. Both were good.  I can see myself making the drive from LA to SF just to come here.

y-LEHwdDxloo4OA1I2IrbQ.review_text: Tenderloin pils was good. Bartender was as he should be; offered me a taste of the sour beer I wanted first to make sure I'd like it. Good thing,  since I didn't enjoy it, but not especially friendly. Want to come back for the pils/brat special from noon to 4. Don't think I'd come alone after the sun sets; area is definitely sketchy.

Vohh0dqc3lekYNDajK0bCg.review_text: Came here last night for pre-movie drinks and really enjoyed my time here! The boy and I came here expecting to try the Beer Geek Breakfast Beer, but instead ordered a Texas Ranger Chipotle Porter and a Walk on Water. The porter had a nice spicy smokiness and the Walk on Water had a really pleasant floral smell to it. Both were great. Will be back again soon.

h8X6a5-fhHdIOL2BH3iTjQ.review_text: What a great place! Soooo many interesting beers!   The bartenders are cool as sh#t! You know there is a pre-requisite to being a cool-as-sh#t bartender: (1) must have a grizzly bear beard (2) must have hipster swagger (the bigger the beard, the hipper the swag)  We had a beerilicious time! Don't know what beer to try? Tell them what you'd like to eat and they can pair one for you.    The food menu is equally superb...we snacked on a few items while playing a game of scrabble, chatting up the bartop neighbors and air-strumming along to a most excellent music playlist featuring the likes of everything in between Nirvana to ALT-J (you will want to check out the latter if you're not already familiar-you're welcome ;)  Here's a rundown of our choices: ++++ spicy giardiniera...they pickle everything in house and it is tart and tasty, not so much spicy, but the thin slices of garlic and serrano peppers tangoed on my tongue. +++++lil smokies...these were cut pieces of an all-beef hot dog, big enough for a slice of bacon's width to wrap around twice and then dropped in an oily bath...you'll never want an undressed hot dog again for.the.rest.of.your.life. +++the salty cod cakes...these mimicked crab cakes nestled in a small pool of remoulade dressing. These were my least favorite, a bit on the salty side, but when eaten with the giardiniera:  mmmmmm!   I had a couple of really great beers. I highly recommend the raspberry triplebock, but hey, what do I really know about choosing beers? Still working on that pre-requisite and having a hard time growing my hipster BEERd :D

VqOVUpvSDzc2rNSa0abYSg.review_text: LAGIT.  Place is huge. Tons of beer on tap. It's clean. Food is great. Wait staff is friendly.

XLPcWy8zcQhxfHY_Bq4VQA.review_text: If you don't know who Mikkeller is, you don't deserve to express a mild opinion about this establishment.

YOg0l4LRbbNkDIneijyV5w.review_text: I came here for the beer and stayed for the fries. What else is new.   It's definitely a diamond in the rough in this neighborhood. It's decorated modern and has a very hipster look inside. When I say that, I mean it has string lights up and caters to hipsters.  I drank the Hoppy Lovin' Christmas IPA. Although that is very embarrassing for me to say out loud, I would drink that all day. I would probably yell it if it meant I could drink it all day. I probably did yell it because it's loud in Mikkeller...and I had 3 of these.  Only downside is that they will totes close on you even if their business is booming. They had a few tables of people and four or five people at the bar and shut down promptly at midnight. Yes, it's a Wednesday, but you should be happy you're getting such hopping (Ayo!) crowds on a weekday night. Don't make me leave and stumble around. I would review the next bar I went to, but I don't remember it. Thanks for endangering me, Mikkeller.

4paWpLov6LjpsNNgE1fhSg.review_text: The beer alone is worth 5 stars as their list is impressive even to the most discerning beer nerd. I expected nothing but Mikkeller beer but, they also source from some other top notch breweries bringing in a stellar selection comprised also of local beers along with some pretty rare finds as well.  As a few others in my group have mentioned, the food wasn't thrilling. I had one of the brats which was pretty decent but, I ended up ordering myself into a carbohydrate overload. "Let's get some pretzels to share..." we're drinking beer right? "Oh and a bratwurst too..." turns out brats are accompanied by a giant roll and a side of fries. "What should we wash this all down with..." obviously ridiculous amounts of beer. Just something to think about if you're grabbing a bit while you're there. Plus you can skip the giant pretzels as they're hard and pretty dry.  Overall, you're here for the beer and that's where your focus should be. If I had known, I probably would eat elsewhere and then go here for drinks but, I still enjoyed most of my meal so it wasn't all bad but, a few folks in my group were pretty disappointed. Still 5 stars though because the beer is over the top.

LLLOyi3WHHBWHv6Uy2ryig.review_text: Awesome follow up to victory hall.. Friendly and attentive staff.. I'm visiting from NYC and this place is legit!!  Fast service even with a full house.. Love the beer selection, food, and the ambiance..!!

ez6UJTbnQz5cSRyk1pXlLA.review_text: I wasn't really sure how to rate this place.  Its a very "trendy" bar.  They do things a bit out of the ordinary ... glassware is non traditional, and the beer is served at appropriate temperatures causing you to wait a few extra minutes for service, which I guess is a catch 22.   Pros: Beer Selection, I recommend sitting at the bar, a few   Cons: Service (people are not very friendly), PRICE  The one exception to the service was this one fellow behind the bar who was VERY knowledgable about the beer and the company! Thanks

xwe5S2LtdDJb_Q_7nKUH1A.review_text: I don't want to sound sensational, but Mikkeller has been revolutionizing the beer scene for the past several years and has the awards to show for it.  I was psyched when I heard they were building a bar in the U.S., and really enjoyed my visit.  Their tap setup is visually impressive, looks industrial.  I will admit that the street they are on has more than its fair share of shambling hard drug addicted zombies, even by San Francisco standards.  Empty crack bags strewn across the pavement.  One block to the east is a relatively safe neighborhood.  At night, one block in the opposite direction makes war torn Somalia look hospitable.  Get the french fries, they are delightful.  If all goes well you may have some of the best beer of your life, and will hopefully not be accosted by a crackhead.  Worth the risk.

3ebGuvvDgFEd5wu6GB2fWw.review_text: Mikkeller Bar is a great place to hang out with pudgy white dudes with backpacks surrounded by drug addicts. The beer is exceptional and the food will give you diabetes overnight. Two thumbs up.

ub8LLRhRXDq6Ceh7sto6Ow.review_text: Great beer selection, but no better than several other places in the city on that front. It also boasts poor value and an absolutely horrible location.  Anyone giving this four or five stars either is a fan or likes anything with some buzz surrounding it.

Mm19NgSRI6ivAoJzgB40Hw.review_text: I was really excited to try out this new brew pub. Got there on a Wednesday evening with a friend around 7:30p and while it was crowded, we were still able to snag a seat. The beer list was impressive with lots of exotic brews to try. I decided to try the... shoot, I forgot what it was called but it had coconut. Yes, coconut. Maybe an IPA? But at $7.50 a pop and 7.7% alcohol for 35cl. Not so bad if you ask me. I also ordered the chicken wings as I love chicken wings. The korean ones were better than the spicy ones just because of the crunch. Oh and going back to the beer, the coconut was just a mild aftertaste. It was really good, I enjoyed it and had a nice little buzz after only one glass. My friend ordered the reuben and fries. Very yummy and very filling. I forgot what beer he ordered... darn!  The service was nice, food arrived quickly and was tasty, beer list good. The only thing was that it was on the expensive side... but really, a new place that has been totally remodeled, in sf, really, can they afford to not charge those prices?

97YdD8tkMkUSvGUw6_u4GQ.review_text: the good, the bad, and the ugly.  THE GOOD: -- excellent selection of beer. I had the house mit and it was clean, light, and full of bubbles of precise dimensions. -- the sausages were quite good. especially the bratwurst. -- pickled vegetable: delicious, great compliment to beer  THE BAD: -- skip the wine completely. they had pinot grigio and pinot noir as selection. the pinot noir was not drinkable -- salad that went with the sandwiches was so stooped in sauce, tasteless -- even though it's free, it probably would have been better to skip this or opt for fries (not a healthy alternative)  THE UGLY: -- super loud place, one needs to shout to hear anything.  -- I had a huge stomachache after going there to eat. something is not quite right on the food front.

4gzvD779lat8hT1TyKLCgQ.review_text: This place could have been much better with better service. The beer was good, I tried there IPA style and it was super hoppy. The food was okay but the thing that really killed the spot for me was the poor waitress staff. They were non existent and the two that we did talk to about drinks made it sound like she was going out of her way to serve us. All in all there are many other places within walking distance that are better than this spot.

F9iBkGHpx3WW-QrIqsziQw.review_text: Expensive and pretentious. The bartender was not very helpful and seemed annoyed when asking for a taste before ordering a beer. Service was slow and food was average. Not being from the area, I wouldn't recommend to others who are looking for a place to stop in and have an enjoyable time.

P-NKOxoJqr9j9Pq2ipXp7w.review_text: Great beer list which is printed up daily, and that's why you're here to begin with.  They need to offer half-pours and flights of beer like other top-flight beer bars. When many of the beers offered are over 10%, I don't think this is an unreasonable request.  Conspicuously dark while being simultaneously spartan and classy.  In a rough area.

nMvd0T2l4CdRCd8KlYc_sg.review_text: Great beer selection. Service is slow as hell. Took 20+ minutes to get a draft beer after placing an order on a Saturday evening.

7FAMblt6-cBXjQ8jITYpUA.review_text: 2 beer (and not even that good hwfewiesen) and spicy peanuts. $30 dollars. THIRTY DOLLARS!   Hippster crowd and cool t-type bar set up. Plain industrial slacker warmish decor with hard cold wood and steel stools and tables. REALLY UNCOMFOETABLE But cool looking I guess?!?  Meh I've seen better and will not probably be back.

uZdFsE_aHbFBChgN6Xa8tw.review_text: This place has great service.  The food is a bit pricey, but expected for SF.  We had the sausage and meat/cheese platter between 6 people and it was perfect.  I had the bomb, which is a dark, coffee beer and it was good!  Very rich and decadent.  They only have beer and wine here.  Their white Windgap wine was ok.   This place got really busy fast.  I'd come here early to snag a table or make reservations.

wFmcrTvirqHfBrxBNI857g.review_text: This bar is AWESOME.  It's located in the Tenderloin, but don't be skeptical.  Totally worth the adventure.   FOOD:  Superb.  Sausages are great. I had the Texas Ranger: it was surprisingly spicy but so good. BF had the Lone Star? (That could be wrong... Sausage, chili, mustard and onions) Also delicious, the mustard was great. We also got the bacon wrapped hot dogs; the bacon was phenomenal. The spicy giardineria was good; BF liked it much more than I do (I was expecting a pickle plate, twasnt pickled). The malt vinegar mayo that comes with the fries is pretty great.   BEER:  I will start this off by saying I don't know anything about beer. However, the selection was phenomenal and the different serving temperatures were awesome. I had a great sour and BF loved their selection of IPAs.   The ambience was great; dim lighting, kitschy art and communal seating. Service was friendly and efficient. I'll be back for sure!

08STwMQ1HFmNbMavYOrUAg.review_text: Hundreds of Untappd checkins and I still haven't reviewed this place yet? I've been coming to Mikkeller bar semi-regularly since its soft-opening two summers ago and it's still one of my favorite places to grab a beer in the city. The lighting is warm, the exposed brick makes my heart pitter-patter, and the BEER -- always a great, rotating selection with a few fantastic SF-only Mikkeller brews. They hold special events with some frequency, like sour fests (speaking of which, check out their bottle selection, especially the sours!), dinners with beer pairings, tap takeovers, and that annual Zwanze Day celebration courtesy of Cantillon.   Don't know what to get? No problem. The bartenders have been, without fail, friendly, approachable, and great with suggestions. They'll pour you a taste so you can be sure you like it before ordering. Hungry? The food's pricy, but their fries and reuben are delicious if you're ever too lazy to leave the bar and venture outside. Looking for friends? Well, the crowd here tends to keep to their own groups, so I kinda prefer The Trappist in Oakland for a cozier, homier, more neighborhood-like feel, but I've also met some interesting folks visiting SF from out of town.  (And I really don't get the complaint about women not pouring beer. What? How many times have you been here? There are multiple female bartenders, although I think more of the bar-backs are male?)

QhGlrGlm73f5TA3Da4BFGw.review_text: Amazing. Get the salt cod cakes!

vdhmqtBt1jkCWh9_-NHhIg.review_text: Mikkeller Bar may be in an unlikely location (only a short distance from the Powell BART station), but do not let that deter you from visiting it again and again- even if the more boisterous patrons from the bar up the street yell at you to come drink at their place instead.   The interior of this bar is amply lit with warm, industrial-looking lights. There seems to be plenty of space to sit, both at the square bar counter in the middle of the space if you are alone and at the cool wooden tables if you are with a group.   From where did all the friendly servers who staff this place come from? Seriously- best bartending I have encountered in a very long time.   The beers, of course, are top-notch. It can be rather overwhelming to choose where to start, but you at least know that you will be drinking down something delicious. The most impressive beer I have tried there so far was a smoked sour! Stunning! Apparently, there is a sour room downstairs. Must go back for further investigation! The menu choices are also selected to pair very well with the vast assortment of beers available- things like bratwurst, pork chops, sandwiches, and the like are on the menu.  To note: reservations are not taken for tables. The acoustics of the space keep the noise level down, so it is a very great thing to actually be able to hear your friends' conversation!   In short, this might just become my favorite place to grab a beer in SF.

89dX_yDmaRKVz_xrRIvNzA.review_text: I have been meaning to try their famous salt cod cakes after seeing them listed on "37 Best Things to Eat in SF". I seized the opportunity after visiting my dentist (who's located at Union Square). I wandered through the Tenderloin and wondered what this place was going to look like... dive, greasy spoon...?  I was in for a great surprise.   Mikkeller Bar is a modern looking, immaculate, and spacious pub with dark polished wood. Even their bathrooms (located down a flight of stairs) are immaculate and spacious too! I easily got talked into a mid-day beer to go with my cod cakes. Opted for a low alcohol beer (4.7% ABV) since I was headed back to work and got the Magnolia Kalifornia Kolsh -light, crisp with a clear golden color. The salt cod cakes were perfectly crispy on the outside with tender and flavorful fish inside. My neighbor kindly shared some of his S&P fries which were a perfect compliment to my beer and cod cakes. Yummy!   This is a great discovery in the TL - definitely try this place the next time you are near Union Square :)

duymKKwUruH8GwbvcaFd0w.review_text: Went last night and it's awesome.  Lots of beer on tap (see list in pic I posted) and the sour room is yet to be ready but lots of great stuff to be imbibed here.  Can't wait to return and try more!  The Spontanale was my favorite along with Lil Mikkel of the Mikkeller beers.

hKwc4stxEQYartm3Q9c74g.review_text: Imma throw this out there right now... I don't drink beer. I came with three dudes who do, and they were pleased. I got a super refreshing fancy lemon soda.  We all split fries and a cheese plate. The fries were perfectly crispy and thin and cane with ketchup and a mayo/malt vinegar dipping sauce that my inner Anglophile appreciated. The cheese plate was absurdly good. We got a cheddar, a goat, and a blue. All very tasty. They came with a fig jam and walnuts with honey, as well as little toasts.   The bathroom was very clean and I really liked the smell of the hand soap they used.

F-ZQYkOlj86k9STgHOf31w.review_text: Very cool venue,  all exposed brick & steel &  wood. An amazing array of draft beers,  and an even bigger bottle selection. Some of the most innovative and "out there" beers you'll ever see.

EhIolH5byA5_IO7VVZyAPQ.review_text: If this is an example of the sophistication of beer's image, I think I'll stick to dive bars. To be fair, the quality and variety of Mikkeller's beer selection is excellent. That's what I was expecting and hoping for. The letdown came from the pretentiousness of it all. Suit-clad bouncers and a velvet rope out front? C'mon. I should have heeded that warning. Instead, we went in and were "greeted" by a waiter tapping his watch and telling us that the kitchen was closing soon. The service didn't get any friendlier and the food was mediocre - I think they tried to get too fancy with the ingredients on what is essentially basic bar fare. I did enjoy the taste of the beer, but I'd rather do that at a comfortable place where I can enjoy the experience, too.

R8SaG2cc54FE9jfVqKDLfg.review_text: Absolutely wonderful, a beer drinkers heaven.  A wide range of Mikkeller beers, plus some exotic other beers all on tap at a perfect temperature.  We also had the olive dish which was excellent.  Go here when in the bay area, its worth your time.

-8ZM-jzJEGkKCxYEJnFrqQ.review_text: Neat space on a crap block! It was MOBBED on Saturday at opening. The beer selection is insane.  I was with "beer people" and even they were overwhelmed. The unfinished Sour Room looks like a spaceship. This place is weird and wonderful.

-9YTqk7Tl3IuSGXvm-AwFA.review_text: I'm glad they built it. Took a bit of a chance with the location but I think it is a destination spot more than a locals hangout. Didn't try the food but the menu looked good. As for the beers I had a few and my problem is price. It is hard for me to enjoy something if I think I've paid too much for it. Pay attention to the size of the servings here. There are 25cc, 33cc, and 50. 50 would be a standard beer at most bars. So, for $7-$8 it's not cheap but for SF not terrible. However... when you order a $9 beer and it's half the size ... that's a problem. Even a strong beer is 1/2 the alcohol of a spirit so you are paying A LOT. You can say it's from a cave in Iceland or an island monastery but in the end it's just a good beer. Give it a try and bring $50 for beers but it won't be a go to spot unless you are a serious beer connoisseur.  Also, this isn't Europe. So when you give a guy a little glass of beer that's not cool either. So, all in all it's good new place but it could add a less expensive option so that the people who get dragged in there by beer snobs can get their 5 Trummerl Pils for $5.50 each and relax.

98DslWquC6ypAJZyZcKcZg.review_text: Great spot for any beer lover and they have a nice selection of cider for those who don't do beer. It can get crowded but we snagged a place at counter behind the bar. The Beer Greek Brunch was one of  the favorites but there were so many options. The servers are very knowledgeable and helpful in navigating the large drink list.  I really enjoyed the Finn River pear cider - it was dry and not too sweet.   The bar food items that we selected to go with our drinks were yummy. The Mac n' Cheese is creamy just as you can expect and the bacon-wrapped hot dogs had the perfect crisp to it.

I2z70DstY8A4cmOxalIAJg.review_text: This place is cooooool.  Great selection of beers and food.  Also very ritzy modern interior.  Gets kind of packed on Fridays, but come at the right time and you'll find seating!

NQ0REATs1_MehrNtnCaV2Q.review_text: Back when they first opened, my boyfriend & a few friends tried out Mikkeller one weekend while I was out of town & determined that a return trip was definitely warranted once I was back in town. Eight months later, we finally made it!  The space is very cool--dark wood paneling, chrome taps & hardware, & a sort of T-shaped bar that provides more spots for bar stools (plus additional tables & chairs in the open space away from the bar). Service was great, & the bartenders were able to answer all of our questions about the various brews & offer suggestions that were spot-on.  I was quite happy with the beer selection. I feel like SF beer menus are often overrun with IPAs, & this one had 42 taps with plenty of variety (plus a bottle list), ranging from more approachable beers to slightly more interesting / funky ones. I appreciated that they were divided up into serving temperature lists because it seems to roughly correlate with ABV, & I was looking to stick with lighter ones that day.  The one down side that my bf & friends mentioned was that when they came the first time, the place was absolutely packed & so loud you could barely hear the person next to you even if you were basically standing on top of them. For that reason we went early (about 5:30) since it was a Saturday & were able to easily snag seats at the bar. However, as the night went on, the place actually seemed to empty out a bit rather than fill up, so we were able to enjoy pleasant conversation all evening without yelling. Not sure if that was an exception, but I hope not!  Love it -- will definitely be back!

c5kmd_wk7gOdDsV4BcplTQ.review_text: Overall I enjoyed my trip here. The atmosphere is fun and the service was very friendly.  This isn't a great spot for vegetarians, though, as the menu is focused on meat, meat and more meat.   The beer selection is really the key here: They have so many amazing beers, including many I'd never heard of before.  Drinks:   - Stone Espresso Imperial Russian Stout.   It was deep, dark and delicious, with a double-digit alcohol content.   Food:   - Salt and Pepper fries  Nothing special (not peppery enough), but tasted great with the house-made hot sauce.  - Salt Cod Cakes  Consistency of a crab cake, though a little softer. Garnished with a really tasty arugula salad.  - Camembert and sharp cheddar  Pretty small portions for the price, but the pumpernickel crackers and amazing crushed, candied walnuts on the side made up for it.

uRAyC6yJkicri7mLekSGKA.review_text: Arguably as good (or even better) than Toronado. Went five nights in a row and each time they had 4-8 different taps than day before in their 40ish tap selections. Some very interesting brews such as an IPA with juniper and pine needles and an English Porter with a hint oh habanero. Sausages are excellent and the cheese selection is very good but limited. Not crowded before 6:30 and even after still better than Toronado as far as seating. Much quieter also. Toronado is louder/divier while Mikkeller is a bit upscale. Depends on your mood where you go. So great to have this new option near Moscone Center. Toronado has more of the beers you know and want but Mikkeller has beer you cannot find anywhere else. ALL styles I and others tried were superb. 6 stars. :)

pme7GsuU86rKc78DMoyBIQ.review_text: I'm a beer nerd and i have been a fan of this danish brewery for quiet a time. Can't wait to stop by again to get my milk stout fix and try some other flavors on tap. Warning: just be careful with the seedy block that it's located at, probably you'll not remember much on your way back :) but it's important to make it safe at mikkeler!

_72jxFkuyg-Xfp71NrURMA.review_text: Great beer selection and having it served to you at the brewers' intended temperature brings out flavors you normally wouldn't know where there.  Service is attentive which ensures your glass is never empty for long, (depending on your rate of chugging).  However, I ordered the fries in hopes of some crunchy snacks alongside my flavorful drinks, and this is where I feel they fell short.  The only thing crunchy about the fries were the little bits at the bottom of the fryer basket they were served in, most were soggy...   Nice ambiance overall, I'd have to try a real dish on the menu to give a true rating on the food.

N9Zjnn-iSpv1khwnJGl0Vg.review_text: Zomg this place was incredible. Sculpin IPA was a real treat for this Portlander

GVpJgeTfkfk3gRbz3UXtaQ.review_text: My wife and I stopped in to have a few beers before meeting some friends for dinner at the Westgate Mall. While I have been into craft beer for several years now, I haven't purchased any Mikkeller's...  Mikkellar Bar has a great variety of beer choices with some being quite unique. I tried a Mikkeller Santa's Little Helper (Belgium Strong Dark Ale) and Haandbryggeriet Bestafar (Winter Warmer). Both were excellent beers served at the right tempature (I.e. not too cold).   We ended up talking with a couple at the bar who had tried a Freigeist Geisterzug Rhubarb Gose and allowed us to try the beer. It was so unique and something that I probably wouldn't have ordered.   Definately come back when in the area. Fun place with cool people...

wVv8-yw8wlzDyYJMDEXFVw.review_text: This is a cool bar with beer on tap served at different temperatures.  The Jackie Brown was deliciously malty and creamy.  The Spontanpeach tasted like dessert wine.  It was the perfect ending to a meal.  My meal included the mussels, which were the best I've ever had.  I highly recommend getting them.  They were small mussels, all tender and the broth had a hint of curry, lumps of chorizo that were house made and crumbled in your mouth.  The pickled red onions were sweet and the toasted baguette slices were buttered and awesome dipped in the broth.    After work seems to be a busy time to have a drink.  There were a lot of guys and some women mixed in the crowd.  After waiting it out for a bit, my boyfriend and I were able to score two seats at the bar, which was 360 degrees and pretty to look at.  The bartenders were attentive and gave great recommendations.

0AZHFsD_dJrA6pgVX-HTyg.review_text: This place was a gem in the rough! Not exactly the best neighborhood but once you step in, you forget you're in the TL slums. They have plenty o beer and even served at their correct temps with a great selection of sides to eat with. Def coming back!

bW4hLfAAJTW8OQ3MopRTeQ.review_text: This place has a very cool interior. They had a great beer selection and I was very excited to see Drake's on tap.  I got the falafel with fries. It was really pretty good. The service was pretty good considering they were packed. We sat at the bar because the wait for the table was so long. We got really lucky. I'd definitely recommend this place to someone in the area.

vNsWVOPGgAoG98MJQx4DTw.review_text: six if possible. just a chill, great bar with great service.  bonus: delicious french fries

dGuuO3t1PXizolUfvh6dIQ.review_text: Great place, I would definitely go back again. The mac n' cheese with bacon was... well come on, it had bacon. Very delicious. The tap selection was of course fantastic. A true beer-geek haven. The right beers served in the right glass, and served at the right temperature from a highly sophisticated tap system. The atmosphere is nice too, somewhat quieter than other beer bars, and the wait stuff are knowledgeable and friendly with pretty fast service. The only thing holding me back from a 5 star is the cost of the Mikkeller beers. It is your own branded place, paying $13 a glass for the Mikkeller "Spontan" sours, that are not the highest rated, seems a bit crazy, even for San Francisco prices. Even their Bruery guest tap beers were not that expensive. The "Spontanframbos" was very good, but this was no Cantillon or 3 Fonteinen, so not worth $13 IMHO.

2SBxCX9cDzrLVdSweCQrXQ.review_text: Mikkeller is great! I went with a friend on Monday and it was still decently crowded, but no wait. The bar was full up and the larger booth tables were all reserved, but there was plenty of communal seating and smaller booths. My friend and I ordered a sausage and a beer each. I highly recommend the Half Smoke sausage.   The wait staff is so nice! Our waitress was knowledgeable and gave us recommendations for everything. We would be so unhappy/lost/eating random things without her!! And when my friend knocked beer all over my half-eaten meal and my jeans, she patiently cajoled me into getting another beer on the house after I said I didn't want another meal, and my friend said he didn't want another beer...   If you can still make me feel good while I'm sitting in beer-soaked jeans, you're a winner in my book. Thanks, Mikkeller. I will be back.

lxOcZ1VZ58nSCFgcunecjw.review_text: Great new beer bar in San Francisco with a ton of different beers on tap.  Right now they have 40 beers on tap and when they have their grand opening they're going to have 100 beers (not sure if that is all on tap or bottles as well).  The bartenders here are really friendly as well and super knowledgeable about beer.  If you're unsure of something ask for a taste and they'll oblige.  It's trouble that this place is stumbling distance from my house.

hFCUoOVs1rA4FX9Vps9fsg.review_text: Great beer selection, awesome sausage platter and terribly unfriendly service. The food was just enough to off set our experience. I know very little about beers but liked that the beer menu was broken out by the different temperatures they're best served at. Different from the usual. I'm happy i stuck with a crisp pale ale to help balance out all the food i ended up consuming! As part of a small table of 2 who successfully conquered the platter, i highly suggest the Chicken & Fennel and Half Smoke.

WzVL87MBvpvR0NgJb8sp7w.review_text: If you want expensive beer in very small wine-type glasses and even more expensive sausages!! sausages I say should not cost over 10$, then go here. The beer selection is extensive and some are better than others but ooooowweeee it's pricey. There are many alternatives in SF where they serve tasty beer in pint glasses and have a better selection of food. Monks Kettle comes to mind hmmmmm. No need to go back unless you have friends who really want to try this place.

JFnDRosLPrK15eCiYjxK8Q.review_text: So it's the new hip place. I'm ok with loudness and prices on the higher end of scale. But the place ends up going for 'cool' instead of 'good'.  I like me my beers, but when we tried 6 or 7 within our group, and not a single one was great, and you get excited about a beer that merely 'doesnt suck' and costs like $10 at that.. yeah you are a hipster bar. Stay that way. And I'll stay away. Waiters do look super professional, but ours seemed stuck up, we had to wait around and make an effort to catch him every single time and he was totally unhappy when we moved to a bigger table when we met some friends. So rudeness of the staff, totally noted.  There are so many places nearby, if you have any flex room, go somewhere else.

y_GMw0XBty_LRrFgSciPeA.review_text: After a disappointingly dry bridal fair around the corner, the bride-to-be and I made a beeline for Mikkeller Bar to cleanse ourselves with meat and beer.  You already know that the beer selection is ridiculous good.  I don't need to tell you that the Freewheel Ironbridge Wenlock Stout on cask soothed away the residual panic of two hundred women looking for the perfect all-the-things for The. Big. Day.  It's no secret that the Allagash Odyssey really does transport to a beautiful ocean of dark, delicious waves.  We all agree that the only thing in life worth reading anymore is their extensive beer list, don't we?   What I do need to tell you is that the Muffuletta sausage is insane.  You guys, is there anything better than a sausage made out of fancy bologna? Yes, there is.  It's a sausage made out of fancy bologna covered in provolone, olives, and CRISPY salami.  Yeah, dude.  Crispy.  Salami.    We were almost totally alone on a Saturday afternoon and it was delightful, but I can see this place being packed in the evenings.  Good think I like day drinking so much.   Oh, and the fries are basically the best.  No competition.*  Bottom line: Duh.   *And I have literally said that "french fries are my Kryptonite" because I'm completely powerless when they're near me.  So, yeah.  Do with that what you will.

b2eLE0oiRlf2Gnpic9WBjg.review_text: Okay, its Mikkeller Bar...why are you even reading these reviews, you already know this spot is top notch.  If you didn't already know Mikkeller is one of the baddest MFin brewers in the world.  We are lucky enough that he graced our city with a fine establishment to drink this paradise liquid..mmm...too tasty.  Oh yeah, and the food is legit too, so you can take your girl there, in fact tell her to bring her friends too.

zyLIp7DRFqeIE1Grrh3Zng.review_text: Awesome beer selection and food is actually pretty good too. Just have to get past the neighborhood! Plan accordingly though, this place is BUSY.

rCsbj_-84Jp2XhokPZ-5-Q.review_text: The beer is unquestionably awesome. Anyone who has had Mikkeller brews from a bottle can imagine draught has to be just great. But... the bar is in the ghetto and the prices are high, both of which I'd forgive if the service had been quicker or more attentive. I can't give five stars to a bar that charged me $7 for a baby serving of beer that took twenty minutes to even get to me. I'd perhaps go again though.

gjh6da4yHahEpQ73O6DX_Q.review_text: Way overrated.  If you like your beer with a side of holier-than-thou attitude, this is your spot.  Our hero was ignored at the bar on a Sunday night a good 15 minutes and then later in the night shouted at by a bar back to order from a different spot.  Don't bother coming here if there's a crowd.  PROS: - They do have a large selection of pretty interesting internationally influenced beers.  CONS: - The attitude of the service here. - Way too packed. - Slow service. - No parking around. - Inflated prices on food and alcohol. - Only beer and wine available.

XiLxIJThWsE0x4d0IeSPsg.review_text: I didn't realize how famous this place was when I found it on Yelp. I'm glad I found it and had the chance to check it out. Now I see "Mikkeller" everywhere.   Everyone who helped us was very friendly and accommodating. The decor is perfect, long pristine wooden tables, high tops, etc. The bartenders were helpful as we tried to make a selection, and were super cool about splitting our tabs.   I enjoyed the Mikkeller Pilsner and enjoyed looking over the menu which included not only Mikkeller brews but great beers from all over the world. So thankful Yelp pointed me in this direction, since I've learned the story behind this organization I'm even more pleased I had the opportunity to try it.

3zxy3LVBV3ttxoYbY4rQ8A.review_text: Wow. I was impressed. Mikkeller Bar has a high-quality selection of beers on tap (42 of them, to be exact), friendly service - and the place is clean! Like, spotless.   For the wine drinkers, they have a very, very, *very* small menu. But you're there for the beer, right?

Ip8ztdExo0hy_ErKr9WoNQ.review_text: Really nice bar with great beer selection. The only downfall is the neighborhood.  While I was walking on my way to Mikkeller, right outside the bar, my husband and I saw a homeless guy pulling his pants down while exposing his rear end (total eclipse), and urinating in broad daylight - I almost turned around to leave but I noticed Mikkeller's door man approached the guy and asked him to leave the area immediately.  The bar itself, its very cool.  I like the style and the simplicity but the space is rather small.  The bar its too big and it doesn't give enough room for people to stand or sit.  They should have made it smaller so there would be more room to add chairs or for people to stand - just a personal opinion. I guess I should stop complaining and just go back but on a day that's not crowded (which its probably in a few months since this place its relatively new).  The beer is amazing BUT the glasses are way too small.  A small wine glass for a beer that cost 10 bucks or more.  I mean, I understand if there are a couple of beers that need to be serve using these type of glasses but every single beer at the bar? I like the place but I don't like the area or the beer glasses.  I can ignore the area but I can't ignore the beer glass - please, make the portions reasonable especially if you are serving a 4-5% beer.

ggwlUc2SV6Tb7beeC7K6QQ.review_text: Great selection of beers. The food selection could be better but the reuben was awesome (a little greasy though)

NYKKt_KU3re0Ot_vFe6Row.review_text: Was craving a beer on my first visit to San Francisco and yelped places nearby. The place is nice, lovely interior, very clean. I had the Kölsch and liked it so much I had a second. Unfortunately, the service was lacking: My friend ordered some fries and had to ask about them twice as we saw that other people that had come in after us and had more elaborate orders were getting served first. He was friendly both times he asked, but the servers replied with attitude. Still, the fries were pretty good. I later had a question and it was difficult to get the bar tender's attention even though he wasn't busy. When I was finally able to ask he answered hastily and sarcastically.

ImxCXwFfBuLojtf6_zUEPw.review_text: I wish I could give this place a good review - instead I'll give it an ok review - they have an amazing. Umber of beers on rap with quite a variety.  Food is not bad if you can find a place to sit but on a Saturday night it was crazy.  It's better than some bars where there's not even standing room but I was hoping for a little better service and crowd management - how dare I right?

BJIxKneZ-_Z2gCLo8DZo1Q.review_text: Amazing beer selection. Cool decor.   Everything is well thought out and the attention to detail shows.   Excellent spot.

g1faDWW6oPYtctjn8RgZqg.review_text: The atmosphere of this bar is really cool. The music is not too loud and you have space. Plus the food is quiet good, they have really generous sausages served with fries, and they have a large choice of beers. The only thing is, it is a little bit pricy (30$ for a beer and a hot dog), but it actually worths it !

Dg1plPPXsJw5qyHcyHIXXg.review_text: Stopped in here with some coworkers for lunch.  Unfortunately I was about to experience the worst reuben I've ever eaten.  Bread was over toasted, completely burnt. The corned beef was EXTREMELY salty and over cooked to the point where the edges were as hard as a rock. There was practically no sauerkraut or dressing.  The worst part of my experience wasn't the sandwich however.  As I came back from washing my hands of the huge amount of grease that came with the sandwich I found my sandwich missing from the table. Apparently the busser thought my barely-touched sandwich was as bad as I did and couldn't stomach seeing it at the table. Much to my chagrin when I complained to our waiter about the sandwich he told me I should have told him earlier before the sandwich was eaten. I told him I would have if it wouldn't have disappeared.   As a small consolation the waiter offered to buy me a beer, too bad I don't drink. He knocked a beer off of the tables tab which was nice but didn't nearly cover the incredibly overpriced $16 sandwich.  I don't blame the server I guess, as he did at least try. But I'll never eat here again.

ofRH_WLCIT_kg-5hIEInoQ.review_text: Beer selection is second to none.  Food was very good, but as far as a stop by for a pint kind of place on my commute home, definitely not, and I thought it would be considering the location.  Had a 25cl (8oz) Mekkeller 5% pilsner for $7.50, then had a 25cl of Ruin Ten from Stone 9.5% for $9. In short, I was just really perplexed by the price point to glassware thing.

ZZ0fsmQf-VLTrSv0T9_cZA.review_text: Very dark, lots of tables and bars to choose to fit your party and style, huge list of "beer geek" beers, very knowledgeable and fun and interesting staff. The sausage selection was great (five artisan-style sausages) and the selection of beers meant it was easy AND an adventure to match them to the beers. They have a $45 selection that includes all five of their sausages, so a group looking for a fun, memorable gastronomic experience has found the right place!

NoOaVw8YAe4SlgWGLWMY8Q.review_text: Great joint, thanks to my local friends for bringing me here. SF has beaten NY to this and props for that. I dug the Bay Area with a hint of European beer hole atmosphere, but everything was immaculate due to this place's relative newness.  The beer list was great, with more Mikkelers than you are liable to find at your best local beer store, and many other great brews besides. They should be saluted for embracing so many big ales and stouts. My only regret was the limited time I had there.  Will be sure to stop by again sometime when I'm in SF!

rtVDtrIm_ZJdoXHXGi8rOw.review_text: Awful! Overpriced, terrible selection (not just breadth- the beer just plain sucks). Overbearing and condescending bartenders (here's looking at you pony tail guy who thinks NOT buying a terrible $75 bottle a waste).   For tourists only. And tech jerks.

6mqnjHUgNEGtb9H5dxQZew.review_text: Service was fantastic. We arrived on Taco Tuesday and had well seasoned tacos with an excellent draft and bottle selection. Add some delicious marcona almonds, pickled vegetables and fries and we had a perfect visit.   Thank you!

1652MDlbA0pOtsq7U1Ygow.review_text: Mikkeller lands in North America in a big way here. An elegant, clean, industrial meets rustic interior. Ample bar seating, spacious booths, convenient location in down town. The food, really tasty, great compliments to the beverage choices. An excellent lunch or dinner location.  But you didn't come here for the food or ambiance did you? I sure didn't. I came the beer. Rarely would I use the word "overwhelmed" to describe my impression of a beer list. That said, it sure does fit here. A massive draft list, an equally impressive bottle list. Mikkeller keeps many of its unique beers on draft and bottle, making this a great source for those hard to find, going to run you 50+ per bottle in a high end store selections. Sometimes they even have them on draft. Orange Yuzu Aren't You Glad I Said Porter... Barrel aged? Why yes, yes  I will. The entire Sponten series in bottle? Oh please yes, Another 40+ taps and bottles? I don't have this much self control. So I went back. Three times in two days. Color me sold, I'm in love with this place.  If you're looking for a break from the west coast style beer (They do have some of that too, though often with a twist), or have never experience Mikkeller, this is the first stop you should be hitting in down town. However if you're just a beer fan, then get going even faster, because you'll want the extra time to pick from the cornucopia of beervana.

YAG90mceVFQLdvl4wndvQg.review_text: + big space + good, unique beers  - food is meh. sausage was okay.

NdEoQxmAig_vp7ZYPMhAXw.review_text: I enjoyed the laid back vibe of Mikkeller Bar...Food menu items are somewhat limited.  Beers are of course plentiful but a bit on the pricey side in my opinion.  I had the Korean Chicken Wings two ways, spicy and honey flavored ($12).  The wings were pretty good, but nothing that I had to have again.  I had a beer that was closest to a blonde, it was pretty good, but again, definitely not worth its' price.  It's easy to spend at least $20 a person here, with an appetizer and a beer, not my kinda thing.  Food is standard and the beers were tasty but I really didn't think it was worth it.  I spent an afternoon in SF and almost wish I chose a differen't gastropub to have my late lunch.

ec_iZRuqulKW0IeY-Zmkcw.review_text: The beer is the BOMB.  The food is the BOMB.  Seriously, the pulled pork sandwich I had like 7 weeks ago continues to blow my mind.  Plus the place is big, clean and modern.  Tres nice!

WI3hWxsihJA8mI5UxNxqmg.review_text: Good beer selection.. Don't go there if you're hungry. Their food has no flavor.  I had the BLT and my cousin had one of their sausages and we were both displeased with our orders. I never write  reviews on yelp but I was so disappointed with their food that I felt the need to say something.

s9Tz1t1Dem16-lVlNfdS_Q.review_text: Irene's review made me smile. I took my "bearded boy" to this "bearded boy beer bar" and we loved it! Haha. Maybe we like fancy beer and being in Seattle, we're used to the bearded pretentiousness that can come with such a place.   That being said, I didn't mind the slight pretention that came along with such a selection. The sours, the Belgiums, the IPAs, the crazy-I-can't-even-categorize all were exciting to try. I'm a sucker for saisons and sours lately and both I tried were fantastic. To only have a few on the list I recognized made the entire experience exciting and informative.   I went twice during my stay, once for just beer and once for dinner and beer. The communal tables are a little weird ("hi new friends, sorry we're late, lemme listen to every world you say") and it's a little bright in there. The service was helpful and helped me choose quickly which sour and saison I'd like the best. If they are spot on with their recommendations, then who cares about a pretentious attitude? It's not going to ruin my night.   Come and try Mikkeller if you're a beer enthusiast and want to find something to raise your eyebrows about.

KB6gQqzPVtHBcD40wf09pg.review_text: I had no idea this spot was going to be so awesome! As we waited in the ridiculously long line for last night's Tim and Eric, we spotted Mikkeller Bar. I was skeptical at first because of the area, but when we walked in I was pleasantly surprised at how fancy it was.   We just had beers that were in very tiny glasses (which was the only uncool part about this place) but I definitely want to go back and enjoy a full meal of food.

gFYqxnA9oDK6tpDWSc_Wtw.review_text: I just went for the first time last week. One of the best collections of beer in existence. I wanted to try a lot of the tap list, and then I did try them. And I was right in my wanting.  Didn't eat there, though the food I saw looked great. Very professional bar. Good publicans with great suggestions. Proper temperatures. Good glassware. I thought the makeup of the crowd was pretty cool too, a good mix of ages and income (though obviously, you have to bring a stack of money with you for beer this good), it's clear that Mikkeller is a destination for lots of people.

6iShvMPfeDS3dq6grbmmbg.review_text: Amazing beer selection. I really enjoy the Mikkeller specific beers here! Other than that, I can't say I really enjoy the place. It's popular and loud, which is nice. Beers start at $7 and go up, with the average at $9-$10. You may end up just standing, but there are places to gather.  I didn't really particularly like the crowd, the bartenders seem to play favorites and take a while. The servers just seem a bit confused and on edge.  I wanted to like it, but it seems like I need more energy to do so. Don't have time for that. Beers are meant for unwinding.

HZW459jMOr-jq05VpxarbA.review_text: My wife and I ate here tonight.  Was pleasantly surprised to walk in on a Saturday night and not have to wait.  Our waiter was knowledgeable about the extensive beer list and attentive throughout the evening.  My Reuben sandwich was excellent. My wife's burger was fine but nothing special. Beer prices were a little high, but I guess that's somewhat to be expected given the location...

-PoCbyNa4xc4yvReuj5pqw.review_text: Came with my lovely girlfriends last week, surprisingly delicious tofu bahn mi. Yummy Korean wings too.  Sort of a scene and the bathroom is soooooo far away done stairs (when you have a big beer in you are are wearing pointed toe single sole stilettos), def worth checking out

05DUOcC_bRngmNRL8rZ-Sw.review_text: Stopped in about 10pm on a Thursday night. Pretty busy, but not packed. Found a spot at the bar and the beertender was very helpful and let me try a sample. The beers here are all very high end and the menu is organized by temperature in which they are served. The food menu is mostly various fancy types of sausage served in a bun with either fries or a salad. Mine was lamb sausage with some kind of cucumber yogurt with dill. The sausage it self was very skinny and protruded from the edges of the regular sized bun. It was delicious.

-THLGnsYKu3yQAsy_tt1fw.review_text: It's like beer heaven. People of SF, I hope you understand the privilege that has been bestowed upon you.   We barely made it in before closing and sat at the bar. We each had a beer and then the really awesome, knowledgeable bartender showered us with small samples of some of her favorite beers...and our favorite styles of beers...and beers we can't find anywhere in Indiana (or maybe anywhere outside of Mikkeller Bar and the brewery where they're made). I could've drank myself into a stupor. A glorious, exotic-beer-induced stupor. I want more!   We happened to be in on grand opening weekend (what luck!) and they had just completed the Sour Room in the basement. I dig the decor. Those nipples are funny.   I can't give 5 stars based on one visit and no food consumed. Ah...to hell with it. I'll do what I want.   Heads-up: because of their liquor licensing, there is no carry out and no one under 21 is allowed.

98kge3NovzBHx61kPyIMSg.review_text: Tripel (9% ABV) and mini weiners. That's the best way to start your night. The bartenders as well as the servers can speak to each of their craft beers as if it was a fine wine or a stinky cheese. Kudos to the management for making sure that their servers are well versed on beer. Sometimes I just need someone to speak "beer" to me.  This place is GORGEOUS!!! Dark and woody on the inside... it's a pleasant escape from the concrete and human feces outside.   Well done, Mikkeler. You have successfully crafted beers and created a space that does not scream of desperation. Cheers to your future success, and hopefully a happy hour in the near future.

_5fFDlrS900UGNF58OkTLQ.review_text: Great beer and service. Love the atmosphere and the lil smokies.  I would recommend for groups and for a date.

tvkIVAG92DkOvrakdzuqtQ.review_text: Stumbled on to this bar while in San Francisco. Good beer, good food, nice ambiance!

Np2q37v8xL_r01XJRPfvnA.review_text: Well, this ain't no poor man's bar. It'll cost you a pretty penny to drink here (as opposed to in Albuquerque, NM).  But the selection makes up for it.  Plenty of Mikkeller beers on tap, as is to be expected, as well as beers from the other brother, Evil Twin. These beers are always interesting and adventurous, so you'll have some fun trying them and will find some that are downright splendid. The pours aren't bad, anywhere from 8-12 ounces for beers that sell at $10+ in most bottle shops.  Beyond MIkkeller and Evil Twin, I found a number of other great breweries on tap, the most notable being Beachwood Brewing and Firestone Walker, the latter whose PIvo Pils is an affordable option and also just a beautiful beer.   I didn't try much of the food, but had the good fortune of going in on the day when the Bavarian pretzel was available and it was the best I'd had stateside.  The atmosphere is pretty pleasant, somewhat minimalist and darkly lit no matter what time of day one visits. The service was surprisingly friendly and I appreciated that.

wOr2y79zfIpytAKOPrSVaQ.review_text: Perfect place to stop for a beer or two and a snack on the way. BF and I came out on a Sunday afternoon before a concert.  Unusual and interesting beer offerings. Not cheap overall but there are bargains on the menu. Instead of opting for the value choice of Anchor Liberty (an excellent beer at a very reasonable price), we tried a few of their unique offerings... I had the Mikkeller Fra Via Til (spiced porter) and BF had the Mikkeller Orange Yuzu Glad I Said Porter and the Mikkeller Beer Geek Brunch (an Imperial Oatmeal Stout w/ Coffee). All were well made, nicely poured and tasty. The bartender was prompt, amiable and available throughout our visit.   We shared an order of the salt cod cakes, which were served fresh and hot with a nice remoulade and lemon wedge. Really delicious and perfect for that mid-afternoon snack. We placed the order with bartender and it was delivered quickly and later cleared efficiently by the kitchen staff. Good service there.  Overall, good beer, good food, good time. We'll be back.

5izbs0G2wOwnMfRiAcG_1g.review_text: I swear, it's just a matter of time before the Tenderloin gets hipster-fied.  Which is fine by me, mind you, if there are more places like Mikkeller.  The food and drinks are delicious.  And after coming off the streets, the clean industrial look is a huge relief.

djWl0HKJwEwWlY-0vo7oRA.review_text: It's a beer lover's paradise! Packed even though their official grand opening is August 9th. They have 42 beers on tap and some good bar food with homemade sausages. The food is bit overpriced and the beer has a higher price tag, but you are getting some good quality stuff, so it's OK right?  Me: Why do they have an artichoke on their logo? T: That's not an artichoke dork, it's a hop. Me: What the hell is a hop? T: It's what you use to make beer! Google it. Me: *Proceeds to Google on phone* Ohhhhh.............  Obviously, I'm not a big beer person, but I do appreciate a good drink! They have such a wide variety of beers that you're bound to find one you love. I NEVER drink dark beers, especially stouts, but I tried the Milk Stout and it was soooo good! It was almost like a sweet coffee (maybe that's why I liked it!).    Great, big bar with lots of bartenders. There are some booths off on the sides. We luckily found some bar seating behind the bar along the wall and only had to wait a couple of minutes. It was crazy packed so we had to flag down someone to take our order. Food came pretty quickly.  - Merguez: the sausages were pretty good, just a tad dry for my taste, the pepper salsa was a good compliment, and the fries were fries - Korean Wings: not much flavor and for $12, I expected more than 7 tiny wings and a daikon salad

e20odwMKY7UqopQkNC3nLQ.review_text: Great beer selection with very knowledgable and friendly staff. The rooster wings were amazing however, probably the best chicken wings I have had in my entire life.

0CZuxFATDp0q1BeZEJ2qPA.review_text: Straight to the point because ain't nobody got time for that.  -Great selection of beers, but not many german styles. Bummer for Octoberfest but no biggy. -Nice tidy little menu with selection of appetizers, entrees, sandwiches and salads. I had the chicken (hen or whatever) on grits with sauce. Tasty. My friends veggy sandwhich was pretty bomb too. -Seating was hard to come by but found a spot behind the bar. That made service hard to come by too.
