Had to work for it but the design and vibe is cozy so I didn't mind waiting I was so relaxed in the joint.  -It's a little pricey but I swear I'm not cheap :)  My overall experience was more like 3.5 stars but rounding down in this case. I would definitely go back for a beer snacks any day.

HCC_eTeq9zRRWrBk0xip1A.review_text: This place was fun! The bartenders were great at recommending a beer I would like off what I told them. They even let you sample some before committing to one.  When I came there was seating at the bar so we were lucky. Seemed to get more crowded as the night progressed.   I heard there's a room downstairs that has sour beers! Will def check it out next time I'm in town!

kY8TJZ9FxXHN_uDb_L8fSw.review_text: I visited this bar twice during my latest trip to San Francisco, once for food and a second time just for drinks with friends. Both times were really enjoyable. The beer selection is excellent and the bar staff know their stuff.  The food selection is basic but great bar snacks and very tasty.  Can certainly recommend!

Dq8NKCoyBS4OBzF6YcMo1A.review_text: Just out of the Financial District bordering the Tenderloin sits the Mikkeller Bar in a very unassuming spot.  Inside is very large, with a good sized taplist that features a good amount of Mikkeller products, and some other interesting items as well.  Cellarmaker beers can be found here as well sometimes, and some other other local offerings such as Magnolia.  Great attentive service, with a full decent kitchen.  May not have the great amazing beers on tap but pretty close though, and the bottle list is fairly solid as well too.  A good worthy stop.

azvfQkZ-6CkMjGYnsKdmTg.review_text: Drinks: The selection of beers is excellent. I tend to go for their sours (since I can't always get them at other bars) but pretty much every beer my friend and I order there are delicious. So you can't go wrong there.  Food: Finally stayed to have their food and I was not disappointed. We had the lil' smokes as appetizers to share and since I already had my fill of sausages (and even though they have a large selection of them which sounded really good) I decided to go for the mussels as my main dish. The mussels were surprisingly delicious. The broth used was so yummy I was using all my bread to soak it up. Definitely recommend  Ambience: I really like the ambience of the place. Its very open and "beer garden" like.  Check it out!

cD2y-iMdLDIPkhYnNNN-wQ.review_text: We were here opening night and it was just OK. The atmosphere and design of the bar is nice. There were alot of people so it was busy.  Their beer is served in a 'Wine glass' and is not cheap, $8. I take a Star off due to the world's smallest beer stein , i think it was 12oz so i want my 4 oz back. I've never been to a brew pub who doesn't offer a Pint !  There were already sold out of the pale ale so we tried the pilsner , it was above avg but not great.  We had to dodge a few drug addicts, homeless, and 'thugs' to get here so be careful walking in this area drunk Or alone at nt .   We thought the Sports bar up the Street on Mason was a 'better' overall bar, cheaper beers, and just as fun-

RoXVNGO66u7q3K15V9wy2w.review_text: Great ambience... very calm and relaxing, but fun and social. Great selection of beers and nice bar staff!

H_DAhIymP_8kpu1kw07Xtw.review_text: mikkeller is sooo nomsies! even though it's located in a less optimal part of the city where i wouldnt necessarily walk there alone, we do tend to come back time and again for their delicious and wide selection of beers, as well as small bites.  the place has always been pretty busy every time i've been, and we usually try 4-5 beers every time we come. they have ones served at different temperatures, which i think is interesting, because it's kinda like sushi, where each fish is optimal at different temperatures..!  yummmm!  im also a fan of the bacon wrapped hot dog bites, and the pastrami sandwich, and the friessss. hehe.

EFeHAWxY4mn4S0mKIOnH2g.review_text: Nice bar, loved the simple but tasteful decor.   Great beer selection that I couldn't get in Phoenix.   The food is paired well if you ask the staff for some recommendations.

Vx-FqwJxqdHgNDAjTO6Evw.review_text: For those who love coffee tasting beers, I recommend you the "Beer Geek Breakfast" beer ! And if You ask, you can taste different drafts !

eplFxqOCSHMgm1GOAS4Fpw.review_text: I want to marry this place. Beers are amazing. Atmosphere is super cool and food is real good. Highly recommended.

N42GJUFWw6iFuBo0f-Dnmw.review_text: I met some friends here yesterday for a drink and an impromptu meal.  We went during prime-time (7pm - 9pm), so this review should be read with that context in mind.  Aesthetic: Well lit, clean, and beautiful interior.  At the time, it was jam packed, so there was little to no seating to be had.  There are tons of booths and communal tables, but if you are going to be here during peak periods, definitely make a reservation!  We did not, but were able to get a couple of delicious beers while we waited for a spot at the bar.  We managed to do so after about 20 minutes.  Beer:  Exceptional list of beers and ales.  The establishment has several house made beers and two different bartenders were able to make great suggestions.  The prices were really no different than any I've seen around town and each beer we had were really great.  Definitely no complaints here.  Food:  I had a Chicken and Grits plate and it was ridiculously good.  Ridiculously Good.  It is hard to find good grits in SF and I loved the corn/red sauce that came with the dish.  Just the right amount of fire in that dish and the chicken was some of the best I've ever had.  My friend had the Fish and Chips and was not disappointed, either.  Not a bite left on the plates afterward.  Excellent meal for the price, as well.  Customer Service:  We sat at the bar (which is U-shaped) and it looked like there were at least four bartenders working the area.  We never sat long without having someone check in on us and all questions we had were answered courteously.  I'm not sure if the staff has worked together too long, and it appeared that there was some stiffness in their general disposition, but I would stop short of interpreting their demeanor as unfriendly or rude.    Notes:  I love Metallica, Slayer, and even Megadeth as much as the next guy, but I'm not sure I'd have a playlist of those bands during dinner hours while people are trying to have conversations.  Maybe that's just me, though.  Also, I noticed that different bartenders would alternate between pouring beers and drinking sips from glasses that they just cleaned and poured.  I was hoping that maybe they were tasting for quality because there are so many different taps going?  If not, it just looked unprofessional.  But again, I might be picky about this kind of thing.  Overall:  I would definitely come back, though I would make reservations.  Three of us drank and two of us ate, with a bill coming in just under $100 bucks.  In SF, that's a deal for a good meal with great beer, if you ask me.  I wouldn't be surprisd if this place gets VERY popular, especially if their food stays as good as it is now.

MGPQVLsODMm9ZtYQW-g_OA.review_text: When I received the news that Mikkeller was opening up their first bar outside of Denmark and it would be located in the U.S., I was giddy. But when I found out the famed brewery's bar would be walking distance from my apartment here in San Francisco, I cried big crocodile tears of happiness.  Okay, so I didn't cry but I may have screamed.  I was there the first week they opened, when the throngs of fellow beer geeks and drive-by patrons made it difficult to actually enjoy my beer. And then I came back to show off our shiny new Danish craft beer bar to visiting enthusiasts. Most recently though, I've returned solo to just sit in this beautiful room drinking beautiful beers while chatting up the knowledgable barkeep.  As you would expect the beer list is always impressive - on every occasion I'm in, I find something new to try along with several personal standbys. As for food, they do it well. However, the menu focusing on housemade sausages is definitely spendy - I get around this by ordering the S&P Fries, which are perfectly golden, crispy on the outside yet instantly all melty, and served in what anyone would consider a ginormous portion along with malt vinegar mayo. For $6, you'll feel like you've been briefly transported to the streets of Brussels. Those fries!  Music is well-curated with appearances by bands such as The Killers, Depeche Mode, and Daft Punk (and not the new album, thankfully). And the restrooms? Unusually immaculate.   Love to love you, Mikkeller.

cpbvGqIRlcssC75xxdmhNw.review_text: Came here for the Amager Bryghus Sinner Series on tap event. Mainly because I want check-ins for Untappd, and I did not want to pay full bottle price for all seven beers.  The place is real clean, and the bar looks all fancy shmancy with all the shininess. I could get used to nice looking bars like this. There is plenty of "standing" space, where all you have is a wall shelf pretending to be a table to rest your drink on, while you chill back and send out your vibe people-watching.  I really hadda drop a deuce while I was here. I had McDonald's on the BART train on the way up. Since I was already BART-filthy and my clothes needed to be burned anyways, I figured why not drop heat at this bar instead of ripping ass all night? So i headed downstairs, expecting a graffiti-filled mudhole of a bathroom.  Nope. To my surprise, clean. A clean, quiet bathroom. With more than one shitter. Hell, it was so clean I almost bare-assed the toilet.  One thing though, no paper towels. Instead, you get that weird airblade thing that sits there on the wall, tempting you every time to just stick your dick in it just to see what it feels like.  F it. I sacrificed my clean hands and touched the damn door knob. I had to get back on BART to get home anyways.

jvDOQZZJv5cFrwi-T4hqAw.review_text: Delicious beer, cool vibe, and amazing salads. Highly recommend this bar/restaurant.

uLYNZUjscG1Gcy7Eo2wViw.review_text: Such a great modern vibe in this bar.  The beer is off the charts with eclectic flavors that you'll find nowhere else!  We loved the sour and salty brew with sour ale and Himalayan salts.  We also liked the lil smokies - a delicious treat!  A must stop if you are a beer lover in SF!

Zm9A2hOZ9y1VaJgJBSL51A.review_text: Great beer bar! I look for places like this that have a large variety of craft beer. Last time I was there I tried three very different beers and loved them all! There is always new and exciting things on the tap wall. The location is great because it's about a block away from the Powell St BART stop.   My friend and I ordered food last time and I had some mac n cheese. It was delish, served super fresh and hot in the pan. She has the little smokies aka bacon wrapped mini hot dogs. They have the perfect small bites to pair with craft beer drinking! The ambiance is very cool and modern with interesting paintings on the wall. They're multiple temperature tap system is pretty rad, not something you see often. The service I've had here however has always just been OK. For a crafty beer bar I expected more top notch service with lots of beer knowledge, but maybe I just haven't have the right server! I'll be back for more delicious beers.

xTdIxiANFE6bQQaNhGJHBg.review_text: Interesting new little spot. Wish we had a chance to sample some of their snacks. We just stopped in for a beer and I really enjoys their selections. Bartenders were helpful and friendly. Seems like a neat spot to spend some time. I'll definitely be back on my next trip.

dR9OiTIjuzvDdoqjuulKrw.review_text: I am a self-professed beer geek and damn proud of it.  Call me the Maestro of Malt, the High Priest of Hops, the Archbishop of Ale.  If there's good beer to be had, I'll be there to drink it.  Mikkeller Bar has been open for a little while, but has eluded me until recently.  When I did finally get there, I was deeply impressed by their draft and bottle offerings.  Make no mistake, this is a damn daunting list.  For most, there are few (maybe 3) what I'll call "safe" choices on the draft list and really none on the bottles list.  Also, as the name of the establishment would suggest, there are a lot of beers from the crazy, Danish gypsy brewer (and even some from his brother).  Because so many of his beers are one-offs, I just didn't know many of the things on the list.  I based my selections on descriptions and bartender recommendations, managing to get some really good beers in the process.  On the food front, the smoked Marcona almonds are delicious and highly addictive.  The beef dip sandwich was very good and were accompanied by some amazing french fries.  Saw several of the sausage plates which looked amazing, so that'll have to wait until next time.  Oh yes, there will be a next time.  So many more beers to try!

gVMpdHHZ9EULicXIYEN8Zg.review_text: Brilliant beer. Not tried the food yet, I guess this means another visit is in order ...

h9AS6_xuu_9U058y-cYgRQ.review_text: My friend wanted to grab brunch at Farmer Browns, but the wait was an hour and a half. Luckily, I read about Mikkellar Bar on SF Gate and wanted to give it a shot. It was open seating and plenty of seating. It was a bit quiet, but it worked for us. The artwork in side were appealing and the layout was nice. There is plenty of beer to choose from and served 45 or 55 degrees. I had the BBQ Ribs and the portion was pretty good and the ribs had a nice kick to it. I would come back.

hpE1j_Vv-Isy2w5zAVWQOg.review_text: Mikkeller takes their beer seriously. So seriously that they serve it at exacting temperatures (as indicated on their extensive menu). I always thought all beers were supposed to be served in icy pints, but that's not the case as it turns out... Who knew?! The food options aren't extensive, but they ARE delicious. Bacon wrapped smokies and farro risotto FTW.   Our party of 3 waited over an hour for a table, but overall, they appear to have plenty of seating both upstairs and downstairs. People just tend to linger over their beers, and I guess I can't blame them...I love the artwork on the walls. Great conversation starters!

9yGYVa3vzl7dm9vBCZ09gg.review_text: Mikkeller Bar had a lot of beer selections that required a recommendation from the cute waitress who served us. I was looking for a Belgian-style beer and the IPA she recommended was decent. Not my fav. But good enough to get a buzz while snacking on the most amazing almonds I've ever eaten (Marcona). It's your typical Gastropub just off Market on the fringe of the Loin. Nice, safe, clean atmosphere inside. I'd definitely go back. Great beer selection and very close to the tourist traps... yet did not feel touristy at all. Everyone in there looked like a local.

7V-9RWgHHmOPD6lPPmaP4w.review_text: Over the past 9 - 10 months or so, I've become a beer connoisseur of sorts. I probably have quite a bit to still learn, but I really enjoy tasting the various brews available especially when you can tell it is being served in an establishment where quality is of highest importance. Mikkeller Bar is certainly a place where not only do you have no shortage of choices(they update their tap list daily, if I understand correctly). A clean, intimate atmosphere with music playing at a more than welcoming volume as opposed to the usual blaring thunder of more divey type bars/pubs. I had two amazing Stouts, the Dieu du Ciel Aphrodisiaque & Prairie Artisan Ales Bomb!, after briefly describing my typically sought out beer to Rich(my bartender today). He let me taste both of these before I selected them, & simply from no more than two minutes of conversation; he served me some of the finest Stout I've had yet. I also had the Mikkeller Burger with Fries which was top notch, cooked exactly as I ordered.  I'm ready to go again, and I was there only a few hours ago.

Le081ROooqFzteWcMs1-1g.review_text: Cool little bar; very clean and new looking. I had the half smoked sausage topped with chili. The sausage was delicious. They make all their own meat and it really shows. I'm definitely going back to try something new. They have a sausage sampler platter for about 50$ which sounded really good. Although the sausages were fairly large so I wouldn't attempt that feat solo.   I also tried a hefeweizen...I can't remember the name. Something like bumble bee or something. It was nice,light, and a bit creamy. They have about 40 beers on tap and a large number bottled...as well as wine.   Definitely check this bar out.

I8coxSMgn3OpifesJmjKmQ.review_text: Would be better if the bar food were a bit more yummy and I beg of you, Mikkeller, please carry a decent gluten free beer, omission lager would be the top pick! Please, I want to drink good beer with my cohorts without gettin dead from gluten! Thanks!

1y2dLZg2l3dtLc1nzU2qzg.review_text: Cool and large brewery with tons of crafts on tap. I tried a couple different beers, one a really tasty IPA and one an interesting sour. The Mikkeller beers, brewed on the premises, are good but they also pour beers from a bunch of different and well vetted breweries.   It wasn't super busy because it was a holiday weekend but it's apparently packed to the gills on most nights. I didn't try the food either... but it's a cool space with an excellent beer selection.

KCaOZUnCx25FJhFr_lKsEg.review_text: Inviting space, decent beer selection, and tasty food.  I feel like some of the prices are a tiny bit high, but otherwise am a fan.  For what it's worth, regarding the 1 star review about nut allergic, 'm deathly allergic to nuts, and had no problem eating the bread (bun) served here.  I was honestly more concerned about the fact that they have nuts on the menu (so in the same kitchen) but everything was fine.

SAm4XpHGqodTvIqYZk_YLg.review_text: I thought I was a big fan until I read about this infamous sour room I was unaware of. Can I still be a fan? Thanks, guys.  Let's get down to business. Mikkeller is great and apparently a lot of other people think so too-I'm referring to its frequently crowded nature moreso than its abundant Yelp reviews. I've been here at least 5 times within the last 6 months in SF (not consecutively) and have never been disappointed. They have an excellent, ever-changing selection with knowledgable bartenders. The food is also good which is a plus.   I'm a huge beer fan and I never tire of their options. I also really like the variation in temperatures they offer. Come thirsty leave happy.

4JDTEX_Ey_qFrCFF5v2M8w.review_text: So, checked this place out on new years eve. Before heading to the Warfield to see Phantogram and the Flaming Lips. It was so...uptown hipster. Lol, we wished we went next door instead, didn't seem as pretentious... Or at least the vibe there felt that way. No judgement really, just kinda felt a little out of place. Beer was ok, ordered the house brew, the pale ale was decent, nothing to rave about. Not sure if I'd come back here. Staff were very friendly and place was clean however can be quite crowded and tight spaces.

MNKa22e08tytuBaF5-SF_g.review_text: Friday night and this place is BUMPIN!! Doesn't take any reservations to my knowledge so if you want a nice spacious booth, come early or be prepared to wait for up to ~1hr. If you  are in a party of two you may have better luck snagging a few seats near the bar / community table areas. The hostess was super nice when we asked to get on the wait list for a booth (we were a big group, 6 people). She let us know that it would probably be about an hour and that we could roam around until a table opened up, and then she would come and find us. My friends and I circled around the bar and man it was packed! We ended up going downstairs and the noise level turned down a few notches. There was another community table down there along with a smaller bar area serving Mikkeller's collection of sour beers. However you can order ANYTHING from the full menu (and pay) and they'll bring it down to you! Good way to beat the crowd ;) It only took us a few minutes to get all of our beers. My friends and I then mosied our way back upstairs when our hostess promptly called out to us to say a table had opened up. Hardly half an hour had passed. WIN!   FOOD -Awesome selection of house made ground/seasoned/stuffed sausages! Drooooll. I had the Saucisson a l'ail (pork, garlic, topped off with caramelized onions). Generous proportion of sausage, hot, and full of flavor. Comes with salad or fries. I chose the fries and that also came in a generous proportion. I was pretty stuffed by the end of my meal.  DRINKS -Tons of drafted beers to choose from. I went for the Passion Pale, a pale ale with mangoes and passion fruit. It wasn't fruity at all, moreso hoppy than fruity.  -Friends had the Jolly Pumpkin Oro de Calabaza. -Huge list of sour beers to choose from as well.   AMBIANCE -Orangey lit ambiance. Lots of people and lots of talking. Fun place to go for small groups, especially if you wait around for a booth.  -Friendly and helpful staff! Our waiter checked on us at all the right times, when we were ready to order more drinks, when we finished our meal etc. Service was fast and great!  First time there on a crowded Friday and my friends and I walked away feeling satisfied and happy. Will come back again and try their other beers! :)

VgtcRwMPiAEeuPsayXB4kA.review_text: The cod cakes, the sausages, and yes, the beer are all great... my issue is with the small glasses. I would've liked to get .5 liter pours, but I suppose this strategy allows to try several different beers. Beautiful oasis in the dreadful TL.

Pf7FI0OukC_CEcCz0ZxoUw.review_text: What's better than drinking a Mikkeller beer? Drinking a Mikkeller beer in a Mikeller bar - with all the offerings on tap, and what looks like some pretty damn decent food to boot.   I'm a big fan of these interesting, diverse, and flavor-packed beers. To seek them out in bottle form is usually a journey that requires trips to specialty beer stores. But with this addition to the SF beer scene, you can simply stop in and quaff some frosted barley pops in an upscale gastropub setting, paired with hearty portions of food.   The place can get crowded, and that's good for their business for sure. I was unable to sit when I visited, but wandering around with a tulip of some heady brew in my hand was just fine with me. As an avid fan of interesting beers, it's nice to have pretty much everything from this diverse line available in one place.   Mikkeller makes some damn good beer. You should drink some here.

lAjajgjQd_uFEBqMVy9kxA.review_text: Amazing selection of beers! I went during the day so it wasn't too crowded, great vibe and the food was delicious. The server was very helpful and gave some good recommendations.

dGND9DDQe5L6Lli2TolF1A.review_text: I stopped in here on my recent trip to San Francisco because I had heard about Mikkeller in Time Out Chicago and had also stepped into Mikkeller's brother's bar in NYC the week before. The selection of beer was incredible and I was able to try a few that I had never tried before. I went at about 3PM since I needed a break from walking around. The bartender was really helpful when I was selecting a beer and I also had a cheese plate, which was delicious. I loved the sleek Scandinavian decor. I also had a nice time chatting with the other people in the bar. This will definitely be on my list the next time I go to SF!

PhKC-5FqCSdZBhLm2xwk_g.review_text: Great, happening place. Delicious beer and food. Plan on grabbing a beer and waiting for a seat to open up if you go around 730-8. I went there on a Monday night and that's how it was for me, so I'd assume that stands for most days. Worth the wait.

kZbVbrvYlbMJa6Z-3FnOdg.review_text: Why do you go to Mikkeller's? Their beer collection!!  You can sample until you find what you like and then enjoy! The environment is very chill and the waitress was very nice and organized (always a plus) They take your name/number and text you when your table is ready (if you need a table) So you can order drinks, chill, chat and wait.  The beer selection though, again....soooo good. Ask for their bottle menu ;) The best stuff is on there.

orxtnZzl0v3XHwz1vj2H8Q.review_text: We tried the sour beers with gooseberry, red currant and rosehip which were all delicious, among the most delicious beer I've ever drunk. A pilsner was nice without being anything amazing. I'm a fan of salt cod and was excited to try the salt cod cakes but they were disappointing - the texture and flavor were not as delicate as I had hoped and they were too salty. My boyfriend's half-smoked sausage was better. Crowded but not too noisy at 7pm on a Friday night in December, we were lucky to snag some seats by the back wall.

YwRxCtMRSntQL_hquH1COA.review_text: The beer and food are great, atmosphere is warm And comfortable and the staff is friendly. I'll be back.

dXgvqyCc67GQAYC1hQHQbQ.review_text: OPENS AT 5PM!    Don't make the same mistake I did and show up an hour before they open.  The interior has a really cool industrial vibe with exposed steel columns and brick.     Service was friendly, but a bit slow.  I imagine this can simply be attributed to having just opened.    Korean Chicken Wings: The first bite my friend took revealed a pink and slightly bloody center.  Sent them back to cook a bit more and he said they were pretty tasty with a good flavor.  Fries: Really nice crisp texture and they tasted fresh.  Came with a side of malt vinegar mayo and heinz ketchup.    Tofu Banh Mi: Slightly underwhelming.  It came with large slabs of tofu.  I wanted a bit more of the pickled vegetables in it and the sauce soaked a bit through the bottom bun, making it soggy.  Decent flavors, but nothing that exciting.   Decent beer list.  I was hoping to see more of the Mikkeller Beers.  The beer menu may have been a 50-50 split between Mikkeller and other breweries.  Beer prices were about $1-$2 more expensive than they should be.    3.5 stars, rounded up to 4, because I'm sure i'd come back.    P.S.  The bathroom is downstairs by the bar.  Don't do what I did and exit through some double doors and walk up the stairs hoping to find a bathroom at each floor I arrived at, but ultimately arriving at a roof access door.  The bathroom is not on the roof.

WihZd-J6aTjGsozuuGWKNw.review_text: Mikkeller bar what can say?? Great selection of beer beer & more beer! Came here the other night with my hubby, place  was packed~ about 15 minutes we finally got a seat @ the bar and about 15 minutes later we finally got noticed by the one lady beer tender~ so 31 minutes into arriving I finally get to sip on my beer it was great! So why only 2 star?? I happened to pay with plastic n tipped with paper. A couple of days later when I was doing my bills I noticed the someone had added a tip to my bill which I didn't appreciate and was very unprofessional!!! If I leave you a cash tip why would you charge me a tip on my cc?? Thats not only wrong but I think its illegal as well.   I tried to contact Mikkeller with an email but no response very unprofessional guys! Oh well, me or my people will not be coming back! P.s. the door guy and beer tender with the long hair were awesome!

eDjB7sq7L6i2W1l4BbN3RA.review_text: Why doesn't this place have more reviews, it is great! A local recommended that I check out Mikkeller for amazing beer and they were correct. What did not mention is that they have awesome staff as well. Trent, the bartender, was so friendly and knowledgeable about quality brews. He gave me samples of beer that I did not ask for just because he wanted to enlighten me about some random fact of beer knowledge.  I highly recommend trying this place if you are looking for quality beer and down to earth bartenders.

j8BihjNFDvLJMjJzriowAA.review_text: Prince Edward Island Mussels, spicy Italian sausages and some great beers.  Bartender Richard helped a lot with our beer selection.  I had the FW Pivo and Mikkellers Rauch Geek Breakfast smoked coffee stout.  Both were very tasty.  Definitely a gem on Mason.

g1u64B_4fChS4lIOiIIeHg.review_text: This place is A. MAZE. ING.   You walk in and immediately feel like you're in a place of true beer lovers.  Everybody, patrons and staff are talking to each other, open to learn and share, and most of all they are all obviously loving their beers.  It's got a bit more of a focus on sours (and can't wait to go to a special room but it's got limited hours) but a sour hater could probably find something they love without much issue.  The place looks great, has awesome beer and is fun... I am glad I don't live here or I would have a permanent indent in one of the seats

YnHf1BPFjfj3kK_i1AC4rQ.review_text: My first time here looked promising! But that was slowly dissolved by the bad bad service and terrible pricing and not enough stock of beer! They ran out of many things I wanted plus the beer was too overpriced! Let me also say the food is also not worth what you are paying for~ N please someone needs to clean the restrooms they are disgustingly horrible!! Along with the bars location~ I will not be coming back!!! Mikkeller you need to get your priorities right!!

yb2erMSDuAAl7-KRnPX_RA.review_text: I have been living so close to this place for almost two years and I can't believe it took me sooo long to discover it and check it out.  Great beers!!! And even tho I haven't tried the food, the menu looks pretty yummy.  The outside, meh, but when you walk in this place is amazing, different too other local bars and the best part, not as touristy as you would think since it is in the heart of union square and the shopping center.  My first time, I came to catch up quickly on a Thursday night with a friend from grad school. The place was packed and we couldn't sit down, but we hung around the bar and quickly ordered some beers. I had the tenderloin IPA and I loved it. On a second occasion I was supposed to meet my friend and her boyfriend for dinner, but the wait was about an hour to get seated so we decided to go across the street instead, but we all wanted to try it together so badly and this past Friday we took it off the list. We came for happy hour and luckily got seated super quickly near the bar. I again ordered my IPA and, even tho it is a bit loud In here, my friend and I had a great time and conversation. We discovered there was more seating downstairs as we'll so now we know!  One thing I loved was the service and the atmosphere of course. Totally different to other brewery like places. Our server was great and super friendly. He kept coming to talk to us about the beers and ensuring everything was great and that us ladies were having an enjoyable time.  No kidding, I live in the corner and this place will indeed be one of my top choices for date nights, happy hours and just whatever my friends and I have going on, at least with those that enjoy a nice, tasty and classy beer. Still need to come and try the food...looks yummy!

xj7T9FRWY5FEZAyVVdltrQ.review_text: So many beers! I've just gotten used to drinking beer, but was definitely the place to be for one! Very crowded on a Friday night and hard to maneuver around the central bar/tap area. We ended up asking for a table which they said would take about an hour to open up. We ordered beers downstairs and once we came back up (say 20 minutes later) a table opened up and we were seated! So lucky given we had about six people. The booth fit us all comfortably and the grub was pretty good! Definitely a small menu specializing in sausages and other easy to eat foods.   Definitely pairs well with the beers they have on tap. Around 8 p.m. the crowd lightened up and it was easier to walk. So if you were to stop for a late beer that might be a better time to go.   They have a lot of unique European beers that are hard to come by, so if you're a beer connoisseur this might be of interest to you! Glasses are a bit pricey, but this is San Francisco after all, and San Franciscans love to eat and drink!
